Reviews.Title: “Stunning, wonderful, amazing, fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jencsav
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner booked a trip to Venice to celebrate my 30th birthday. After reading some fantastic reviews about Ad Place we decided to make a reservation, and we weren't dissapointed, this hotel was the most delightful place and we had a really fantastic time. We were welcomed upon arrival and then shown to our room 'Giugno' (June) which really had the wow factor with lovely stylish decor and a view of the beautiful canals from both windows. After checking in the hotel staff provided us with lots of information about places to visit and things to see. They also recommended some local restaurants, which were truly amazing. Breakfast was served from 7:30 to 10:30 each morning in the central breakfast area and there was a fantastic array of pastries, cheese, boiled and scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, juices, teas, everything you could want and more! This boutique hotel has just 12 rooms, the reception is on the ground floor and most of the rooms are on the first floor, with the breakfast area being in the centre of these, which means just a few paces to get your breakfast each morning! On the day of my birthday my partner had a few surprises planned, a marriage proposal being one of them! The hotel owner - Alessandro - really couldn't do enough to help him with the surprise and went to a lot of trouble to decorate the room on that day by putting candles, rose petals, a beautiful single rose, candelabras, a vintage bottle of prosecco and strawberries in the room so on our return from a memorable gondala ride, the room had been wonderfully decorated, it was the most romantic thing I've ever seen. To top this the gondolas could be heard singing outside the hotel which just made this the most romantic and enjoyable experience ever (I'm smiling now just thinking about it!) I will remember this experience for eternity and my partner and I are so grateful to Alessandro and his team. We will definitively return to this hotel in the near future, we're currently considering it for our honeymoon. So, if you're thinking of booking this hotel just do it - don't even think about it - Venice is a wonderful place and getting lost in the winding streets is an unforgettable experience. Our top tips are to sample a Bellini or two, buy some Murano glass as a momento to take home, and just soak up the atmosphere and enjoy this wonderful city. Once again, thanks to Alessandro and his team - we will be back as soon as we can - and in the meantime just keep doing what you do to make your hotel a truly wonderful place to visit, we just can't recommend your hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: shjnmee
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice! The staff were wonderful, helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a good combination of bacon, scrambled eggs, croissants, cakes, fruits, juices and cereals, it was served between 7:30 and 10:30 am, excellent timing whether you are having a lie in or starting your day early. They provide tea and coffee all day (self service) in the breakfast room which you are able to take to you room or enjoy the rooftop terrace. We stayed in the 'September' room and were amazed by the elegence and wow factor of the room as soon as the door was opened! The room did have a mini bar with drinks at very reasonable prices. The hotel staff recommended some super resturants and provided us with a map, highlighting all the must see sights. To be honest, the staff couldn't do enough for us, they were so helpful and nothing was ever too much to ask. We did not book any trips before going, the hotel arranged a walking tour of San Marco and Doges Palace and a shared gondola ride (much cheaper than if you arrange yourself). If you are interested in having a wifi connection during your stay then they do provide you with an access code upon check in to use during your stay. The location was perfect as it was easy to find (the hotel emailed us a map before our arrival) and in a very central location between San Marco and Rialto. Prior to our trip, we did contact the concierge regarding how to get from the airport (Marco Polo) to the hotel and they were very informative and provided websites we could book transport through in advance. We ended up booking with Alilaguna and paid 24 euros each for a return trip from the airport. The water taxi was every half an hour and from San Marco roughly took about an hour and twenty minutes. The hotel did also tell us that a private water taxi would be about 120 euros from the airport. We fell in love with Venice and recommend you get lost and explore all the winding streets. The hotel was a big part of our stay and we were more than happy to return to it every evening. Very romantic! We can not thank the staff at the hotel enough for all they did.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun & well located”
Reviews.Author: kidwell_james
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend in mid March. We arrived and departed by boat taxi direct from the airport which cost 120 Euros each way but was a lovely way to do it - all organised via the hotel. The hotel is quite new, and the staff were extremely polite and helpful and very good with their restaurant suggestions and general knowledge of Venice. Our bedroom was interestingly decorated in a modern version of baroque - all very opulent. My only negative was that the lighting was quite dim - probably deliberately so for atmosphere - but it did make reading quite difficult. The breakfasts were good with the usual international spread of options and plenty of coffee and tea on a help yourself basis. We found the hotel to be very well located as it is about 10 mins from St Marks Square and a short walk from some lovely squares with restaurants in them and the bridge across to the Guggenheim etc. The ferry and tregetti stops are close at hand too. A potential drawback for some is that the rooms are all on the second floor as is the breakfast room - only reception is at ground level. This didnt worry us as they were very happy to porter our bags and there is a stannah style lift on the stairs if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, stylish hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonChrissieC
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Ad Place in Venice. On walking into the reception, we were greeted by our names, which was a really nice touch. We were also upgraded to a junior suite. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, the location was perfect, and our ground floor room overlooked a canal which was popular with singing gondoliers, which was really lovely to hear and to wave at the gondolers from our window. The roof top terrace was also a delight, and we were served complimentary drinks there on our last night. Breakfast was geneous, and free coffee and cakes were available all day. I would definitely recommend the Ad Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hobbelvorster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AD Place for two nights at the end of January for the birthday of my mother. We were 9 persons total. We booked 3 standard and 2 superior rooms but at arrival the 2 superior rooms were upgraded to junior suites. A pleasant arrival after some struggle to find the hotel (Venice really is a labyrinth at your first visit). All rooms were very beautiful. Pleasant staff and good breakfast. The only disadvantage I can think of is that there aren't enough tabels during breakfast to seat all guests. When we had breakfast all together and when other guests arrived they couldn't sit anywhere. We got two bottles of champagn and a complementairy private boat tour to Murano. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “central, unpretentious, stylish”
Reviews.Author: sterners
Reviews.Content: Chose Ad Place after reading Trip Advisor reviews. It lived up to all the comments made about it. Very central, but in a quiet area - a short walk to San Marco or to Academia bridge. Really not difficult to find if you have a map and a sense of direction. Rooms were stylish and fun - slightly over the top, but entirely appropriate to Venice. Bedroom and bathroom were very clean, and well serviced every day. My room was quite small (lovely firm bed), but we were out almost all day, so it didn't matter. If you feel like spending a little more, a superior room will give much more space and a better canal view. Lots of stairs to climb, but good for working up an appetite before going out to dinner (hotel recommended good restaurants). Breakfast good, with lots of food - fresh fruit and freshly squeezed juices, bread, pastries, limitless coffee and a small amount of hot food. Staff were fantastic - very friendly, chatty, and keen to help - nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and private”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: Wonderful clean spacious room with view to garden. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Great location. Best breakfast of anywhere we stayed during our 7 days holiday. Would definitely stay here next time we visit Venice. Stayed September 2011, travelled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in a great convenient location”
Reviews.Author: M0_the_Expl0rer
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in AD Place. The staff are fantastic and cannot do more to help and always have a warm inviting smile, no matter what time of day! Beatrice very kindly made lots of lunch/dinner recommendations and booked them all for us, which was very kind. There were lots of lovely little touches - like offering us hot chocolate proactively when we came back to rest our feet from the cold...Kamal also gave us a free bottle of champagne one evening with a selection of snacks and fruits! We had a superior room which was very large for Venetian standards and was beautiful - it had a gorgeous view of the canal and was so romantic with four-poster bed and lovely decor - think antique furniture with a slight modern twist - Venetian style but without the gaudiness. The slight let-down was the bathroom, which was rather narrow and looked like it could do with a slight make-over. There was no bath which was a shame but the rain shower itself was fantastic with good pressure. Another (minor) gripe was the hairdryer which was awful and doesn't generate any heat at all and having long hair, this was frustrating. But Beatrice in reception happened to have a spare hairdryer for me to borrow so this was not a problem. I would advise you to take your own portable one. The location is one of this hotel's best features. We were 5 minutes from San Marco square and 10 min from Rialto - we walked everywhere and didn't have to rely on water taxis at all except to and from the airport. Bearing in mind that water taxis are expensive in Venice, this can be a huge cost saving. Another point also is that there are lots of good restaurants very locally within 10 minutes of the hotel so you needn't venture too far if you were feeling lazy. Breakfasts were good and plentiful. The warm options were not that great but we didn't mind as there was a lot of fruit, pastries, cheese, yoghurts etc. All in all , this is a a great hotel - do take the private water taxi from the airport but if you do make sure they take you RIGHT IN FRONT of the hotel!!! Ours conned us and dropped us 10 minutes walk away and not ideal when lugging a suitcase over two bridges!On the way back to the airport we took the water taxi right from the front of the hotel ...it's expensive but the views are jaw-dropping and it's so much fun. Also , do bring your ipod as there is an ipod dock.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: HasnahH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in November 2010. Unfortunately when we arrived in Venice my 14 year old daughter had an asthma attack. The staff was so helpful they called a doctor who came immediately and my daughter was sent to the hospital for further treatment. Despite the ordeal we enjoyed our stay at the hotel..the rooms were bellisimo and the breakfast were delicious..staff very attentive and so kind and polite. Lovely hotel especially for honeymooners. . Planning to stay there again if we ever go to Venice .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemita_83
Reviews.Content: It is tucked down a little side street that is a little tough to find but as long as you follow the directions then no problem at all. It is really central and handy fior everything. The staff are friendly and are happy to help with any enquiry. Breakfast is very good and there is complimentary tea, coffee and pastries available all day. Room is great, very unique. Bathroom clean and modern. All in all a very enjoyable stay and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights in mid-January 2012 and we had a beautiful Venice experience. The hotel is just a bit tricky to find (if it's your first time in Venice) but it definitely deserves it. The whole hotel has a personality, beautiful decoration and style. The breakfast room was pretty nice with sofas and little tables. The hotel provided us with espresso/tea 24/7. Also they had some croissant available at all times! (No-extra charge). Our room was spacious enough for Venice. Very clean and cozy, the bathroom was brand new (as the entire hotel is 2 years old). Really liked the bedroom, very stylish and of king-size proportions. Finally everyone from the staff was genuinely polite and friendly. Especially Massimo who welcomed us and gave us some tips and the young girl who served us our breakfast every morning and made us more than one cappuccinos each day!! I would definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “hurrah”
Reviews.Author: vladimirdasic
Reviews.Content: Hurrah â€¦that was the first thing we all said when we entered into our room (Marzo). What a room. So spacious and colorful with nice view to some of the channels. Coffee machine was there and also Sony Play Station so my older boy was very happy. Location is also nice as you can reach St. Marco in 5 minutes (if you know the route). Breakfast is also great. Cannot recommend this hotel more â€¦you have to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Eclectic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1moretimetraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 1 night in mid October 2011 at Ad Place! From the minute we entered, we were made to feel very welcome and one immediately feels the advantage of staying in a boutique hotel. We had a basic room which was tiny but had such a lovely feel to it that we didn't mind the small space. The bathroom was a good size! Breakfast was excellent! The hotel is so close to all the main attractions and we loved walking and getting lost in all the little alleys along the canals! Just loved Venice and would definitely stay at Ad Place again!

Reviews.Title: “Truly No.1 romantic place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: veraye
Reviews.Content: We spent there 5 days and it was another beautiful honeymoon-like sejour. Wonderful sights, very hospitable personnel (they were always there to help us with anything we needed), perfect location, etc., etc. Highly recommend to those who like the combination of staying in 2-5 minutes walk from all the interesting places and still having all the pleasures of secluded and quiet love nest.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good”
Reviews.Author: Santa_Maria_Japone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ad Place for 4 nights after Christmas. As sama as others in Venezia, our room is very small even thought our room was a junior suite but location is very good, close to San Marco. And we were surprised that this junior suite did not have a bath tub. The staff was very kind especially a gentleman at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Ad Place - The Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Adrian&Rohan
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Venice at the Ad Place and couldn't have found a better place to start our holiday and celebrate our 18th Anniversary. The location was excellent, being just off the main streets but within easy access of the Vaporetto stops, San Marco, Academia and Rialto and on one of the minor canals overlooking the Teatro La Fenice. Also several good restaurants and squares around to have a meal, drink or just people watch. Check in and service was a breeze especially appreciated after 22 hours travelling and special thanks to Alessandro who was always friendly, ready to help and had a welcoming smile after long days of walking around Venice. The other staff at breakfast and reception were also very friendly and efficient throughout our stay. We stayed in a Superior Double Room (think it was the Magio room) at the end of the breakfast room. Very quiet, clean, spacious and very Venetian feel but with a modern touch. Only slight downside was the bathroom was narrow but very functional. Also included were breakfast which included a selection of meats, cheeses, yoghurt, fruit and cooked options as well and free Wi-Fi which worked very well throughout our stay. We had a good view from the small Juliet balcony of the canal and the Teatro La Fenice and were serenaded whenever we opened the window by passing gondoliers. If we go to Venice again we would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it. Thanks Alessandro and the team for a great start to our holiday, hope to be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The complete Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: BarronsSydney_
Reviews.Content: From the minute we stepped off the ferry, then down a little lane and around a corner to walk in the front doors of Ad Place we knew we were in for a wonderful experience. The rooms are done in completely Venetian decor. Ours overlooked a small canal which was lovely as no noise and yet the gondolas would go past occasionally which was a great experience, as we could have almost touched them. The breakfasts were very special in a lovely room on the first floor with everything you could ask for, a big fridge, a bar, TV and fresh pastries and fruit left out during the day. Our own espresso coffee machine is our room, a four poster bed with curtains, marble bathroom, the list goes on. Alessandro, the manager, made our lives very easy. Nothing was too much trouble, everything I requested appeared like magic, from an international adaptor (after leaving mine at the last hotel) maps, laundry, charged my portable charger, a cup of capuccino while I was sitting one afternoon in the lounge area, the list just goes on. We can't recommend this hotel enough, it was a true Venetian experience as we walked out of the hotel and 2 minutes later found ourselves in the main square. Bliss!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great place in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: 137JohnD137
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in early October 2011. From the minute we walked in the door we knew we had chosen the right place. We had received a map and clear instructions as to how to get to the Hotel from the Airport, and we had no trouble following them. The room was spacious, comfortable and always clean. The bed was something special. The people at the front desk could not have done more for us, and their fluency in a number of languages made the place even more warm and comfortable. The breakfasts were adequate, good quality, and more than we could eat. The location was as good as it gets in Venice. I would recommend AD place at a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “quirky.. romantic.. a bit on the small side but it's Venise after all”
Reviews.Author: JoPro-UK
Reviews.Content: we book long time in advance via Lastminute so was a bit surprise of the price at first. we took the vaporeto from Marco Paolo airport which was direct or almost to the hotel... a short walk and we almost found the hotel entrance by accident: as you do in Venise: everything is found by accident in this maze of small street; any way the hotel room was on the small side but very romantic under the roof.. with biscuiti and exspresso machine available all day and night in the common room... we didn't get canal view as we'd asked but had very nice stay the staff was great and lovely too always ready to help out. we spend a tremendous long week-end there. location is ideal too, close to San Marco and few minutes away from the rialto bridge, almost in front of the Guggenheim I would recommend anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and funky!”
Reviews.Author: gkealy
Reviews.Content: To begin with, from the Venice airport we took a water taxi to the hotel.. it was high tide so the driver couldn't let us off in front of the hotel. We were dropped off at a small dock near the Grand Canal. This was one difficult hotel to find from that angle. We had 3 suitcases and walking up and down bridges and the steps was frustrating..Everyone we asked said "just go straight". You CAN'T go straight in Venice! We looked forever and I got cranky..finally found it. Couldn't check in until 2 so we dropped our bags and walked around Venice. Went back and checked in and took a good look. Very nice young man at front desk, huge apples and chocolates at reception. A very odd mix of black and grey striped walls, Bohemian mix..wood beams on ceilings. We stayed on the first floor in the "December" room. Four poster bed with canopy, bidet, TV mounted on the ceiling. Huge wood framed mirror sitting on the floor. Gondolas outside of our window and we could periodically hear them singing. Very comfortable bed with great night's sleep. Didn't remember that the room included breakfast the next morning. A wonderful spread up a couple of flights from our room. Pictures included in this review. Getting to the airport from the hotel was another adventure. There were three choices but we decided to take no chances and take the water taxi again..it was expensive..I think over $100 euros. High tide again and the front desk said they weren't sure that the water taxi could arrive in front of the hotel. Well, it did..but it was a real experience trying to get the two of us and three bags into the water taxi -- we actually had to throw one leg over the side and be pulled on to the boat! It was cold and rainy but we made the right choice..directly to the airport dock where we paid another $20 and a service took our bags and us right to the check in line at the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel..it's a bit out of the was, but a very interesting experience. The hotel was clean, different and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations of any hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Adorable place to rest when in Venice. Very quiet, pleasant, immaculately clean, and wonderful staff all around.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you stay here if you come to Venice, you won't be sorry”
Reviews.Author: Timmy373737
Reviews.Content: We have stayed all around the world and this hotel is easily one of the most funky, unique and interesting hotels we have stayed in. The decor of the rooms is brilliant, an interesting mix of 'Charlie and the chocolate factory', meets 'Alice in Wonderland' with touches of luxury added along the way. The location is excellent, 7min walk to San Marco piazza and very close to a range of great bars and restaurants via winding backstreets. The breakfasts were great (and I have high standards when it comes to hotel breakfasts). We were already excited about Venice but this place just made it an even better experience. Don't stay at the big American chain hotels, stay here, you really won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BEGL
Reviews.Content: Really lovely little boutique hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Well located for San Marco Square with excellent designer shops on the way there. Great individuals rooms and good breakfast choices. I would recommend wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff in a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danusia9
Reviews.Content: If you wish a lovely boutique hotel in Venice look no further. It is located 5 minutes from the hustle and bustle of San Marco Square but what seems a world away facing a little canal. I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff were so helpful, hospitable and friendly. I arrived after midnight and was quickly checked in. The receptionist asked if I was hungry and I said I would be fine. He nonetheless brought a snack which was so thoughtful and very welcome. The breakfast which is included in the room price was the best I have ever had in a B&B. The room was beautifully decorated and everything was modern and very clean. Again back to the staff who can make or break a holiday they were so knowledgeable in history and culture with perfect English. A wholehearted thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patti9999
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! I moved my vacation around so i could stay here and im glad i did! Its not far from San Marco but yet in a quiet corner where you can occasionally hear a gondalier singing to his passengers from your room. Breakfast had the most variety i saw on my trip and the staff was the friendliest i encouter in all of Italy. My room made me feel royal with the chandalier and tons of pillows. I would definately stay her again and again and have already recommended to friends. Stay here and you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: eastridingowl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights as a special treat. The hotel is not cheap (and neither is Venice!) but we really enjoyed our stay. We had a superior room overlooking a small canal (some way down) and were regularly serenaded by passing gondoliers. The free champagne was served beautifully with nibbles and strawberries, and we found the endless free supply of excellent coffee (and often cakes) just outside our room very welcome for a mid-afternoon break from the sight-seeing. Venice is a really special place, and the AD Place was just what we wanted; romantic, centrally placed and just a bit quirky.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: L M
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome! We stayed at AD Place for our honeymoon. The rooms are beautiful, romantic & very clean. Open your windows & you'll hear gondaliers singing as they float passed the hotel...so perfect. We were big fans of the breakfast - plenty of yummy options! The staff (esp Alessandro) was so so helpful & they offered great suggestions for sunsets, dinners, etc. We will definitely stay at AD Place on our next Venice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magical”
Reviews.Author: Danielle B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ad place 2 years ago with my husband to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. I was completely charmed. The staff was delightful, the location ideal, and the facilities impeccably clean. What really got me was the decor! I was blown away by the intricate details that created a romantic haven. I tend to be pretty demanding when it comes to hotels so it says a lot that Ad place surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Besviken”
Reviews.Author: bob f
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel. Breakfast was poor, and rooms were poor quality. Terrible sound insulation, we could hear every footstep and wardrobe opening and closing from the room next door. There was not even enough tables and chairs to seat everyone at breakfast. Good location but we won't be staying here again even though we are planning to go back to Venice. We were very disappointed with our stay at this hotel. It's a 3 star hotel at a push.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TenBobDaveW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AD Place in October 2010 for 5 days, during which we got married at Palazzo Cavalli! What a great location and base for exploring the San Marco area, with the hotel being located right next to the Teatro La Fenice. The closest vaporetto (water bus) stop is Santa Maria del Giglio. Like most Venice hotels, AD Place can be a little hard to find at first, but if you remember it's next to the Santa Maria del Giglio church and the theatre, you can't go wrong. The rooms are all individually designed, and we stayed on the ground floor in a junior suite. The decor is stunning, the beds huge and comfortable, the bathrooms well equipped and very modern. Breakfast is the only food available in the hotel and was a little limited, but we were happy with bacon & eggs as the only warm option. One downside is the breakfast room is on the top floor and there is no lift, so if you have difficulty with stairs, maybe this hotel isn't ideal for you (although I heard they will bring breakfast to your room). The staff were excellent, and even arranged for a surprise tray of Champagne & nibbles for our return on our wedding day. It's the little touches like this that make some hotels stand out and the reason why people visit again. Thank you! I must agree with the other positive reviews of this excellent boutique hotel. If you enjoy the large hotel chains with countless facilities then maybe this hotel isn't right for you, but if you enjoy a personal service in unique and luxurious surroundings, I can't recommend AD Place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely decor, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: TottyMoto
Reviews.Content: So glad we picked this hotel. Getting there was easy from getting off at the S. Giglio stop on Line 1 of the vaporetto - straight up the little alley, through the small square (Campo San giglio) over the bridge to the left at the end of the square and then it's on your left. It's not signposted outside but just look for number 2557 which is on the outside of the building The staff were lovely and spoke excellent English. There are no lifts but they will take your luggage up to your room for you. We were initially in "Dicembre" room, which was lovely. Small entrance area then separate bedroom area with 4 poster bed that had a tv above it on the ceiling! I think someone else has mentioned there's not much shelving in the bathroom but it's an insignificant thing compared to how great this hotel is overall. We had a tour guide meet us at the hotel one morning and the manager overheard us telling her we'd just got married and when we returned in the afternoon we had been upgraded to "Marzo" room - which was incredible - small lobby, lounge with tv, minibar, coffee maker, tv and exercise bike (!). Then bedroom with 2 canal views another minibar and tv and a sony playstation. Bathroom had a huge bath, 2 sinks - the whole thing was amazing. Even without the upgrade i would have been delighted with our stay - as i said staff were lovely, especially Alessandro who helped us with questions about directions/booking transfers etc, and if you need, they will print off boarding passes for you. The breakfast room is lovely, with plenty of choice. You can make yourself an expresso from the machine but there is also a member of staff around who will ask if you want tea/coffee/cappucino etc. The decor is amazing, a lovely twist on traditional Venetian style, with bright funky colours and interesting details on the coffee mugs and cutlery. If you need to use a computer just ask at reception and they will give you a laptop and password, you can take the laptop to your room if you like or use it in the seating area in reception. There's also a little rooftop terrace with sofas which is nice to relax on in the afternoon after a day walking around the sights. Very near St. Marks square - 5 mins maximum and Rialto about 10 mins and great that the S. Giglio stop is so close by. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. If you have any questions about this hotel or Venice feel free to PM me :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming, boutique hotel near St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: DC1211
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last 4 days of a two week trip to Italy at the AD Place in Venice. This is a hotel that is in an excellent location and close to the more popular sites in Venice, but in a quiet area. Late in the afternoon each day, we were serenaded by a wonderful singer on a gondola floating past the hotel and our room window and each morning, we heard the local church bells ringing!! The staff were all very courteous and helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent - good variety!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jrandsk
Reviews.Content: While a bit on the expensive side, this is a quirky hotel with great charm, that is superbly located, quiet and with staff that provide superb service

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli36422
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September 2010 for our 10 year wedding anniversary. The hotel was wonderful. Our room was beautiful, the breakfast was delicious and had plenty of choices, and the staff was very friendly. The location is great for individuals who want to visit several of the main sites in Venice. Very easy to get to from the train station. I would recommend to couples looking for a romantic spot.

Reviews.Title: “Unique. Modern. Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: catbarrk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just concluded a two week tour of Italy, ending our trip at the Ad Place in Venice. What a gem of a hotel! The location is unbeatable, the staff is courteous, and the hotel itself has a nice balance of elegance and whimsy. We booked a double room, expecting the typical small bedroom. What a pleasant surprise. While the bedroom itself was small, the bathroom -- and accompanying dressing room -- were quite nice, making the room overall feel much bigger than it was. Not to mention that our room overlooked the neighboring canal, which also happened to be a gondolier path. So we were serenaded with opera at sunset each night. All in all, stay here. You can't beat the location and design at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic boutique hotel in the heart of San Marco â€¦ attentive staff and great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Dante_the_Florentine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a two week trip around Italy, and spend 2 luxurious nights at the Ad Place. This hotel was the perfect sanctuary to call â€˜homeâ€™ while in Venice very close to all the major sites; Piazza San Marco, Dogeâ€™s Palace, the Academy Gallery, and is a stone throw from the historic 'La Fenice' Theater Our hosts during our stay were Beatrice and Kamal, and they both took great care of my wife and I during our wedding anniversary vacation. On the second night we were treated by an upgrade to their superior double room, and indulged with complimentary chilled prosecco and treats! Perfect pampering after walking 10 miles around the grand canal and all the beauty of Venice. Beatrice checked us in promptly and gave us plenty of recommendations for authentic venetian restaurants, which were all excellent (please check out Rosa Rossa!). The rooms were all beautifully furnished with contemporary and bright Venetian flair â€“ check out the luscious fabric covered walls â€“ and great attention to detail; Murano Glass chandeliers, antique furnishings, and wonderful opulent bed linens, and toiletries by Etro. The rooms are more than adequately sized to be comfortable during our stay. On a note, to some reviews that mention the stairs and rooms size, please bear in mind that this is Venice afterall, and this is a historic building built upon wooden pilings in the lagoon., and size is a constraint everywhere. The Ad Place hotel has transformed this space into an airy and sumptuous space, which will be remembered for many years to come. They have a luggage/Chair lift and concierge to take your bags to your room, so donâ€™t worry that there are a few stairs. The staff will take care of that. For the unbeatable price and location, we found Ad Place more than exceeded what we were looking for in luxurious comfort. Beatrice and Kamal were very professional and helped answer all our questions making the most of Venice in the time we had, and gave great memorable recommendations for restaurants without hitting the tourist traps. The rooms were very comfortable and opulent and the refinement and attention to detail was impressive. Lastly, by treating us to chilled Prosecco and larger room, just made us fall in love with this hotel and enjoy the most out of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close but misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Practical info for you to decide when comparing similarly priced hotels...and remembering that you will spend most of your time in Venice and not your room (so this hotel did not in any way take away from the stunning magic of Venice!). The good news: the hotel goes out of its way to answer questions about Venice(I had many by email before arriving, and they answered all quickly and thoroughly), and they surprised us with champagne on our last night. BUT...(1) no elevator (important if you have any mobility issues, or don't want to climb 3 flights of stairs at the end of every day), (2) very quirky layout, being an old house converted so rooms are odd sized and lacking any functional layout (no closet only a small wardrobe with 5 hangers, two drawers, and the bathroom is without any shelving) plus floors VERY creaky so you can't move quietly at night, (3) confusing food setup, mugs were available occasionally for the coffee machine but sometimes the entire coffee supply would disappear or there were no cups at all for the day and there was no coffee offered at breakfast (but it seems you can ask for it to be made specially...again unclear and if you don't inquire you won't know what is or is not included). It's on a canal, yes, but a small arterial one and the rooms face a building so 'canal view' is out your window, looking straight down to the small bit of water below. Kamal was particularly helpful and arranged all transfers perfectly on time. It would be hard to find without a water taxi so recommend the added expense vs the public taxi (a nightmare of lineups, additional fees for luggage and only one piece is allowed, and you would struggle for an extra half hour just trying to find the place unless you had GPS or Google Earth or something like that). Internet is free (great!). Coffee I consumed in the common area was not cleaned up after 12 hours on two occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for making our stay so pleasant and memorable”
Reviews.Author: lisachung15
Reviews.Content: I am quite particular about where I sleep but this hotel has definitely not disappoint me. In fact, it has given us a very pleasant and memorable experience. We were there for our honeymoon. Highly recommend this hotel. Also, thank you so much for giving us such a pleasant surprise with the nicely decorated room, champagne and snacks. 1. Superb location. Right next to San Marco and nice wander along the laneways to Rialto. 2. Staff is friendly and always helpful. They help to carry up our luggages to our room and recommend great restaurants 3. Room is great, very "venitian" setup, clean and tidy. Bathroom is spacious and modern design. 4. Breakfast is held at the lounge room and is plenty. It has hot breakfast to go with it. Lots of varieties. Quality is great with specially served coffee of your choice (cappuccino, espresso etc). There is a coffee making machine with coffee and tea are available for free to all hotel guests round the clock.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very central to everything....”
Reviews.Author: Pr1982
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at the Ad Place Venice Hotel in April 2011. We found our stay fantastic, having coming from the port of venice we took the ferry boat to within five minutes walk of the hotel which was very handy. The Hotel is located centrally, there is so much to see once you walk five minutes either direction. We found the hotel very clean, stay very helpful, especially Kamal who presented us with a bottle of champagne and snacks on our last night there. Lovely room and we found the roof terrace a great place to relax and read.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you need wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: jonnytekno
Reviews.Content: It pains me to give this hotel 2 out of 5, but I feel I have to warn others about the wi-fi. In this day and age I believe that decent wi-fi in a hotel (especially an expensive one) is no less essential than hot running water. If you are reading this then you are a trip-adviser traveller and will, I'm sure, agree with me. The wi-fi in this hotel does not work in the rooms, you have to go into a communal area to use it, and even then it is very intermittent. This shouldn't be hard to fix so they need to pull their finger out. Anyway, otherwise I would have given a 4 out of 5. Here are general pros and cons: Pros: Friendly and helpful staff Very nice breakfast buffet Lovely style of hotel and very nice rooms (at least ours was) Nice venetian style roof terrace thing Nice central location, but away from busy crowds Good room service Cons TERRIBLE wi-fi No lift - climbing 3 flights of stairs after day trailing around in 33c not good Location is slightly dull - if you want to be near night life (what little there is in venice) this is not the best location Weird bar thing where you have to ask staff for a drink who aren't always around lots of led lights all over the room

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! Look no further and book!”
Reviews.Author: Bengia
Reviews.Content: The team headed up by Alessandro and his brother were fantastic! They gave you all the information you required and the outlay and cleanliness was the best I have stayed In any hotel In the world. Look no further and book this hotel, everything about it was awesome. Thank you for making my girlfriend and I trip all the way From Sydney so enjoyable, I hope we can return the favor if you ever decide to come down under!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KristianDerrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AD Place for our Honeymoon... the rooms were really funky, cleaned and tidied twice a day plus it had an iphone dock for music... the breakfasts were great, plenty of choice, bacon and scrambled eggs, croissants, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, juice plus more! Kemal the chap who worked nights was really nice, he lit candles in the room and served us champagne as part of the 'honeymoon package' and served us a couple of mojitos on the roof terrace. Only downside was the lack of lift, we were on the 1st floor and after a long day walking they were a nightmare (50 steps in total, we counted!!), there is a stanna stair lift but with 4 flights of stairs it would take ages! so maybe book a ground floor room if your lazy! But still a 5 star rating from us.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kups23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Venice. The staff were all excellent and very helpful. The room was beatiful but there were a few stains on the carpet (Not a big deal as they give slippers and room is kept very clean). The location was excellent, a short walk to the main square and excellent restaurants. The best part of the hotel was the service from the staff. No major complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff made the stay!”
Reviews.Author: SanMateoCA
Reviews.Content: We are currently on night 2 of 3 at AD Place and are having a great time, which prompted this first review on TA. Our family of four (with two small children) is comfortably situated in the November suite, which has a sofa bed in a separate sitting room for the kids. What really makes AD Place so special is the exceptional staff, most of all Kamal. He is extremely welcoming and helpful and is full of recommendations for any request (laundromat, restaurant, gelateria, etc.). Agree that location is great (close but quiet), decor is funky and fun, room is clean, and breakfast is good. Air conditioner in our suite worked very well - nice and cool! However, it is the team that makes this a hotel that we will both recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “You will love staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Annie055
Reviews.Content: Not your run of the mill place ~ so much fun after standard hotels! Each room had its own unique flavor that it was fun to explore. Unfortunately our room was on the top floor (we are 50ish) and it has no elevators and steep steps. However, they cheerfully took our suitcases (and we had 4 heavy ones!!) and said they do it all the time! We discovered a delightful balcony there. It overlooked a canal and had interesting roof top views. I spent some time there with my kindle and listening to the gondolas go by - heavenly! Easy walk to places and close to the water taxi. The best surprise of all is the incredible breakfast buffet! We have never seen anything like it! The presentation was nice and felt homey and the food was wonderful! We talked about it for days! Yes we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT LOOK FURTHER !!!”
Reviews.Author: nyorker3331
Reviews.Content: just got back from amazing trip. this hotel was one of the highlights of our vacation.excellent location very central but away from the crowds.as we walking in we were greeted by alesandro... what a nice guy... very welcoming and helpful. he upgraded our deluxe room to this amazing suit... heaven over looking the canal with a great view. later on we met kamal which is in charge of the night shift. we were hungry late at night and since we were so tired to get out he managed to make us a great late night dinner ... he was always smiling and very nice. in our last night in Venice he surprised us with a bottle of proseco - nice touch to end a vacation the rooms are very clean romantic and very hip. great breakfast well working wi fi internet in the room.this hotel was a great choice made our stay in Venice even sweeter

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel with very Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: AncasterOntarioguy
Reviews.Content: Ok, this place is a little treasure. Beautiful inside and out. It's small but so well designed. We had the first room on the main floor. "November"was the room name. It was lovely. We had a very large room with sitting area and large bathroom and very large bed room. It was very nice to open windows and shutters leading to the street and over the canal. The gondolas went by our bedroom window (below it) and you could hear the singing etc as they went by. Very nice. The room looked totally new. They had a lovely breakfast and cappacino area on the 2nd floor. Very clean and it had lovely pastries and fruit etc. for breakfast. On the next floor up you could go to the roof deck which was mostly not used by visitors when we were there. they had a lovely cushioned seating area with tables etc to put down your drinks. It was curtained off as well. You had a lovely view from the roof. So nice to sit up there and get way from it all and listen to the church bells ring in the nearby cathedrals. Staff were awesome. Upon our early arrival they informed us they were upgrading our room. The front desk staff were very informative. They treated the guests like family and informed them of things to see in the area. It's definately a place to stay in Venice. WONDERFUL FRIENDLY AND SAFE. Perfect location about a 5 minute stroll down the street to the water buses that take you to the train station or other areas of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DancingTraveler85
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and was pleased. Location a little difficult to find, but in a great location close to the vaperreto and major sites. Hotel Design was not really my taste and the incense was a little strong in the room and pillows were insanely hard, but staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was very nice and it was lovely having the canal outside the widow where you could hear and see gondoliers passing by. Nice hotel but a little expensive but then again it is Venice in July!

Reviews.Title: “small friendly hotel in ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: lizrobb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from a 4 day stay at AD Place. The hotel was very easy to find (using the map on AD Place web site). The hotel was very clean and tidy. All the hotel staff were VERY friendly and VERY helpful. The room (August) was situated on the 2nd floor literally in the breakfast area (as were other rooms) August was quite a small room (for the price we paid) the bed was comfortable - we both slept well (air con could have been better), iPOD station, TV, safe (which didnt work) and fridge, free wifi. Shower cubicle in the August room no bath.Window looks out on another building very close (but this is Venice) with canal underneath. On arrival the air con was broken (at the time it was being fixed) but to be honest its not the best. No lift and several flights of stairs. Breakfast was very good loads to choose from cereal, fruit , yoghurt, meats, pastries, juice etc coffee machines (guests able to help themselves to cofee all day) rooftop terrace - ideal for relaxing at night with a nice glass of vino and listening to the singing gondolias and church bells. location in Venice is brilliant quiet area but not far from all the sites. Rooms were cleaned each time we left our room, fresh towels etc. To be honest we wanted a nice comfy hotel and one which would be an ideal base from which we could explore Venice this hotel was bang on! - i mean you dont come to Venice to sit in an hotel room all day ! therefore AD Place was ideal we loved it and would come back again - although we are still unsure about the apple decorations in the room lol !

Reviews.Title: “Hidden location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: L0ndonGent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in early June. AD Place is a gem - a charming, boutique hotel located right in the heart of Venice yet located in a quiet backstreet that is tranquil, quiet and away from the hordes of tourists trampling through St Mark's Square. The rooms are not extremely spacious but a reasonable size for Venice and comfortable and well-appointed. We had air-conditioning and a standing fan which was a godsend in the heat and stillness whilst we were there. As mentioned elsewhere, there is a good continental breakfast to start the day and the staff are courteous, friendly, polite and always there with a smile. The winner for the hotel is the location, hidden away behind La Fenice on one side and a church (I couldn't tell you which one) on the other. Aperfect retreat from which to explore the delights of Venice. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Biviers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location (but very difficult to find...), the hotel staff is nice, the breakfast is just outstanding and you can even ask a gluten free breakfast (if you ask a head of time), they don't have gluten free breads though but have few cookies and crackers. We had a really tiny bedroom though, I think the hotel has some bigger rooms, for sure ask for those ones!! Know also that they don't have elevators, and the stairs are really deep!

Reviews.Title: “FAB HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AUDIRS4England
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating a special anniversary and chose this hotel as the reviews were great. We were not disappointed! We booked direct with the hotel website as it was cheaper than all of the other sites. I did mention the reason we were coming to Venice and the owners took note as we were treated to an upgrade and champagne. The hotel is a boutique hotel with 12 bedrooms and is family owned. The owners and staff were absolutely first class. Nothing was too much trouble. They were great at recommending restaurants and places to visit. A special thanks to Kamal for his great service. The location of the Ad Place is fab. It's in a quiet location yet just 5 mins walk from St Marks and also the Rialto bridge/Grand Canal. Pleasant informal breakfasts. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ivana622
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, helpful staff. Beautiful rooms . Great breakfast. We would stay there over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite! You MUST stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: RBDreamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this Fantastic Hotel, and wish we had stayed longer. The helpfulness and friendliness of the staff was exceptional, and we felt we were treated as if we were their only guest. They were warm and patient with us as we oriented ourselves in Venice. The breakfast buffet was fresh and plentiful, and the arrangement of a private water taxi to Murano was a lovely touch. The rooms were beautifully decorated and extremely spacious. We had a breathtaking stay that we will remember for a lifetime. It was a truly wonderful hotel and experience at one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We have already recommended/insisted to our friends that they must to stay there when they visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our stay in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Evaeli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotels all over Europe but AD place had to be our favorite hotel. We found the hotel very easy to find as we took directions from there website. The hotel is perfectly situated minutes away from the st Marcos square. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by one of the staff who quickly processed our reservation. He took the time to give us a map showing us all the popular sights in Venice & even writing Down a few lovely places to eat. He assisted us with our luggage to our room. We stayed in 'june' & found the room perfectly sized for us. Very lovely romantic decor & a nice view of a canal below. Quite often in our room we would hear church bells ringing, gondoliers singing & accordians playing as they floated pass on there canal. It was a very lovely experience. We enjoyed the breakfast service, my hubby loved the coffee & I found the chocolate muffins amazing! Very good selection of hot & cold. It was always very quiet so no need to wait in a long line to get your food like when you stay at the larger hotels. We also enjoyed having the espresso machine & drinks available throughout the day. It was so nice to be able to come back to the hotel after a hot day & enjoy a quick relax & drink. Ad place made our trip to Venice a lovely experience. There flawless customer service combined with romantic themed rooms & a delicious breakfast makes it the best choice when looking for accommodation in Venice. We look forward to staying again someday in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Upgrade - Grt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdubbers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon and one stop was to AD Place in Venice. The service was perfect, very nice front desk. Very clean rooms. Great breakfast. Large size rooms, in comparison to normal european hotels. All of the rooms are named by the months. We were originally put in "December room" - on the first floor but very private and safe on the canal. Then the front desk told us they were going to upgrade us on our las night there, being it was our honeymoon. They went above and beyond, and gave us the most beautiful room, March, with a canopy bed and HUGE living room. When you opened the windows, you looked out to this sweet canal and small bridges and could watch the gondola rides go by. That night ,Kamal, at the front desk (super nice), set up champagne, strawberries, and a ton of lit candles in the bedroom with rose petals on the bed. It was so romantic and really made our trip. Thanks Kamal! Also, the location is amazing if you want to be able to find romantic and beautiful piazzas other than the very popular ones. You can walk to the Rialto and San Marco in minutes. There are signs everywhere directing you to the main places. I would definitely go back and recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff & Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: danieltjames
Reviews.Content: Really impressed with all aspects of our stay. The location is excellent, easy to find and get to and is in a really good spot. The hotel is stylish, fun, quirky and unique. Modern yet tastefully designed and with everything you could need. Friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff. Great value rate booked directly with the hotel. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If looks only mattered”
Reviews.Author: mattie12903
Reviews.Content: This place looked great. The breakfast were also great. some of the things missing here was instruction. We visited 4 cities while in Italy and all of them were clear on what was included with the price of the room. This room offered the least for the most amount of money. The air didn't work the shower was small and leaked. We were not the only ones with problems with the room. Another couples room was flooded. The manager did compensate for the air not working, but I'd try another B&B next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing decor, great location, LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: Pursie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the hubs for our first trip to Venice. It was absolutely gorgeous. The bed was so comfortable and we slept very well. We had a lovely window overlooking one of the canals, and could hear the singing of the gondliers as they would go by ferrying passengers. The hotel is easy to get to either by water taxi (expensive) or by the water bus (much better deal- about 2 Euro.) There is no elevator in this very charming building, but that is Venice. Also, the bathroom was a bit small, but again- it's Venice and space is at a premium. It is very easy to walk where you need to go from here. We walked and browsed and never failed to come upon a wonderful view or tiny sandwich shop. The staff was very helpful with recommendations or with being helpful in anyway in which you may need it. I had some postcards to mail and they offered to do it for me- including getting the postage for them, which I thought was very nice. The rooms are very well insulated and we never heard anything from our neighbors- of which there are few. This is a boutique hotel specializing in service and presentation. Free wi-fi is provided. We were not disappointed and would stay here again without reservation, as well as recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: thedudenator
Reviews.Content: Would agree with all the other reviews ...... Hotel is in an excellent location, comfortable yet quirky rooms & a very decent breakfast ..... staff are very helpful and Kamal was kind enough to bring complimentary champagne, strawberry's & nibbles to celebrate our wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita”
Reviews.Author: HollyGoesLightly
Reviews.Content: Just a quick walk from the Giglio vaporetto stop, St. Mark's and the Rialto, this hotel could not be more convenient. And from the moment I walked through the door I felt relaxed and welcome. Beautiful red Murano chandelier, luxe patchwork wall hangings, warm woods, Henry James quote painted on the wall, dark chocolates at the front desk. All so charming! Friendly, super-fast, and easy check in, immediate upgrade {even though booked through an online hotel discount site}, amazing room {post & beam, hardwood floors). And after asking me where I wanted to go first {Harry's Bar}, and showing me how to get there on a map, the front desk manager carried my luggage up 4 flights of stairs. Bathrooms feature Etro toiletries and I don't think I've had a better night's sleep while traveling -- very quiet and oh so comfortable bed! The church bells of Santa Maria del Giglio will wake you as the sun is rising, and it is very likely that someone singing O Solo Mio will lull you to sleep. If a room is available at this hotel during your stay in Venice, book it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: akpadham
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and charming hotel that is well located in Venice. We loved our rooms as they were spacious, warm and comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and modern looking. The staff are extremely friendly, especially Alessandro (Alex) :). Every morning the breakfast/eating area had a lot of food and so much variety! Everything was well displayed. I highly recommend people to stay this hotel while in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and full of character”
Reviews.Author: BLT1991
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with a family of 4 (2 teenagers). It was a great stay. The hotel was easy to find off of the water taxi stop. The location was greatâ€¦close to St. Marks, but far enough away to be quiet in the evening. Beatrice, at the front desk, provided great guidance on dining and activities (gondola rides). Kamal was very accommodating and brought us complementary wine and snacks. Breakfast was good. The room had a great air conditionerâ€¦not a given in Europe. I had read that first floor rooms can be â€œaromaticâ€� in Venice. That was not a problem here. We were in a downstairs room (the November room)...in terms of improvement, they had the potential for many satellite TV channels, but didnâ€™t have the signal strength in that room to get most of themâ€¦except the Iranian channelsâ€¦an inline amplifier would go a long way. They had also mounted the TV directly onto the ceiling above the bedâ€¦it seems neat, but it was tough to angle the remotes properly to operate the TVâ€¦it would have done better on the wall in front of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Ruby Wedding Suprise Trip”
Reviews.Author: jennireyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of March. it was a bit difficult to find, arriving at St Marks Square by vapretta in the evening and in the dark. When we did find it, it was worth the treck. The boutique hotel is small (twelve rooms all named after the months of the year, we were in Maggio) the hotel recepton is very quaint in a boroque kind of way, heavy velvet curtains, candels lighting the stairway and great venitian chaderliers. From the reception you walk up two flights of stairs (no lift) to the dinig room and most of the beedrooms lead off this large room. Our bedroom was beautiful, padded fabric walls, velvet curtains, four posted bed and looked out onto the canal. Breakfast was typical continental, but plenty of choice, and although there wasn't tea or coffee facilities in our room the coffee machine was always on in the dining room to help yourself. The staff were very helpful, giving us tips on where to eat etc. The two managers were very helpful, especially kamel the night manager who couldn't do enough for us! Our daughters organised a bottle of champain to be delivered to our room, not only did we get the champain, but also a tray full of nibbles, crisps, olives and fresh fruit, and there was no charge as it was our Ruby WA!! We enjoyed it so much we ordered another the next evening!! all in all an excellent little hotel,

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: Chibi_1
Reviews.Content: Planning for a romantic honeymoon or getaway? Look no more because this is just the perfect selection! We stayed at the hotel for our honeymoon in March and was really proud of our choice. We were worried in case the web photographs and comments did not match reality. But what you see on the web is exactly what you will get, and with added value!! We arrived on a wet and rainy day. Took the long way without knowing there was a short cut! We asked around for directions to the hotel with the name of the street and had no problem finding it because it was just that easy. Walked in the hotel lobby and before we could say a word, we were greeted and addressed with our names by the director of the hotel (as we found out later). Without further delay Alexander helped us with our luggage and took us to our room where we were introduced to a beautifully Victorian style decorated room with a bed like the ones Princesses sleep on! There are 12 themed rooms in total, and we got the Maggio room. We loved this room. The windows open to the canal below. You can also hear the church bells ringing during the day. It rained most of the time we were in Venice as it is Spring. But we were not bothered by it at all. In the stillness of the night you can hear the rain drops pitter pattering on the cobblestones with footsteps of a passerby echoing in the darkness. It is as if you were taken into one of Shakespeare's scenes. When the hotel learnt we were there for our honeymoon, we were given a package that includes a complimentary tour to one of Murano's glass factory and the best part is, free Champagne and romantic rose and candle decorations in our room on our first night! What more can we say... This is a unique and boutique hotel that is located away from the crowdedness in the many areas of Venice from zillions of tourists every parts of the year. But no where is far from any where in Venice. Every place is convenient and within walking distance, otherwise the Vaporetti is of easy access. We found this place a great value for money, very clean and tidy, and breakfast is provided! Internet is charged in many Italy accommodations, but there is free wifi here and it is fast too. Special thanks to Alexander and team for such a memorable stay in Venice. It made a great difference to our first experience in Venice, and we will definitely pick this hotel again when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Was a Great and Quiet place to stay a few steps away from carnival crowd”
Reviews.Author: Domingos_Rodrigues
Reviews.Content: We stay there during carnival season, travelling with a baby. All the atmosphere of the hotel is great with a unique boutique style, the staff real helpful providing tips and prompt help with a smile. The location is great, just 5 min walking distance from S.Marco, even so quiet. Good breakfast. As improvement probably will be good to have in future baby chairs in this area. On the last day we received as goodbye present Champagne and fruits which was a real nice from the staff. Is a ideal place for a romantic trip to Venice. We stay in a room with the TV in the roof with a king size bed a space enough for the baby cot with a pleasant decoration. For sure coming back to Venice this will be THE place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fionatsmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. Fantastic central location, with no bridges or steps from the Vaporetta for when we arrived and left. Really nicely decorated room. Slightly chilly under a light duvet, and solid, heavy pillows. Very small bathroom, but nicely done. Good buffet breakfast with everything that you could want. Blissful having tea and coffee and cakes all the rest of the day. Very good service.

Reviews.Title: “It's really a charming hotel...”
Reviews.Author: alinna_romania
Reviews.Content: is a great hotel, very well located and easy to find. is perfect for a romantic trip. room was exactly as shown on the site, and the breakfast varied and good. also the hotel staff was very professional and we communicated very well. I would like to thank you for the kindness Kamal services. I can not wait to go back to Ad Place venice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: nicolas-fr34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days at this fantastic hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The staff was very nice and very helpful, and they made every possible effort to make our stay an extraordinary experience. And it was indeed an extraordinary experience. We were in a =magnificent= suite overlooking a beautiful canal just across from "La Fenice" (the Opera). The hotel is ideally located just a few minutes away from Piazza San Marco. We definitely recommend this fantastic hotel for a magic experience in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - the best value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: YonitG
Reviews.Content: We have just came from an amazing 4 days vacation in Venice. The "AD Place" hotel was absolutely perfect!!! The hotel staff was absolutely amazing â€“ they helped us with every question, recommendation were all good and helpful ( place to go, restaurant, etcâ€¦) The location was absolutely amazing â€“ 3 min from s. Marqs squareâ€¦5 minute from Rialtoâ€¦.very quite location but in the heart of everything. The Rooms was like a dream, we were upgrade to DLX room with canopy bed, the bathroom was pretty nice (shower no bath) but with good amentias and all very clean and with morning and evening cleaning services. We got Champagne, cookies and peanuts on arrival and the breakfast was night in a nice room All in all, this is THE PLACE to stay in Veniceâ€¦.Amazing place with outstanding service and help from staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Happynanna
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel. It is in a superb location, very close to St Marks Square and adjacent to the opera house. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was so tastefully decorated. Coffee, tea, cakes and fruit were available at anytime, you just helped yourself. Our room was spacious and overlooked the canal, very quiet. Fabulous hotel with very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - what a find!”
Reviews.Author: JANDM65
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Ad Place, in Venice, for four nights. It was our 'final fling' before our first baby arrives and we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Being nearly 7 months pregnant, they were extremely accomodating (even offering for us to change rooms to the first floor, which we actually didn't take up as were fine with the stairs - even if a little tougher at the end of long day's walk around Venice!). Getting from the airport is a little testing but as long as you print out a map and try to have a vague idea of how to use the ACTV (public boats) in Venice, you should be fine. It is very close to the Giglio dock and pretty straightforward from there. The rooms were great and very original. The only downsides were that for a superior double, we felt the bathroom was a little small (no bath either) and the pillows were quite hard but that is personally preference. Every time we left the hotel, we came back to find an immaculately tidied room and the bathroom products were always replenished. Breakfast was delicious with a great deal of variety on offer. It is nice that you could take your time too, with last service at 10:30am - if you wanted to sleep a little later. The staff were extremely helpful and special mention goes to Kamal for his great restaurant recommendations (we loved Rosa Rossa so much we went back twice!!). He was always very obliging and bringing up a bottle of complimentary Presecco for our last night was a lovely touch.) With great location and value for money, we would strongly recommend this hotel for the perfect place to stay in Venice. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy and confortable place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: HVaz
Reviews.Content: A very nice and elegant hotel in a quiet water street of Venice. Prepare to walk few steps if you stay at top floor (3rd). Very good!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely service”
Reviews.Author: mikeyserpico
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a short break at late notice to Venice at the start of January. Although the AD Place wasn't cheap, it looked nice and was in a good location, exactly 5 minutes walk (yes, I timed it!) from Piazza San Marco and when you're only going for a few days that's important. A number of reviewers on here have mentioned that the hotel is hard to find - I would agree to some extent and it is definitely worth printing out a map before you arrive. However, basically everywhere is quite hard to find in Venice (part of the charm of the place) so I can't really complain on that account. Location wise you're right behind La Fenice, with access to the Dorsoduro and south west from the Accademia bridge less than 10 mins walk, the edge of Piazza San Marco 5 mins away and the Rialto bridge less than 15 mins walk. So essentially it's a great location. It's just off the main tracks enough that it's quiet, but not so far that it seems like a trudge. For a short break, it's perfect. There are only 12 rooms in the hotel, so it's very bijou and boutique. When you walk in the reception area is nicely lit, with a collection of interesting "objet d'art" scattered around, some funky furniture and a small bar area just off the hallway. As with most Venetian hotels, there are plenty of steps. As you leave the reception, you have to schlep up a couple of steep flights of stairs, and although the staff are more than happy to help with bags, it could be an issue for some people. I think there are a couple of ground floor rooms and there is also a Stannah stair lift-esque device for people in wheelchairs. Once you reach the first floor there is a little communal landing, which becomes a breakfast room in the mornings, with tea and coffee making facilities available. If you take another flight of stairs, there are more rooms and you get to a little veranda which would be lovely in summer for a pre dinner Spritz, but wasn't much use in the cold January evenings! The room we had was off the breakfast room, called Giugno (June - all the 12 rooms are named after months). The room wasn't big by any stretch but it was fine, and again, it's Venice and space is at a premium. The bed was large and comfy, there was a big flat screen tv on the wall (showing 90+ Italian channels) and a decent sized wardrobe. The en suite was excellent quality, with a good strong shower. A bath would have been nice for relaxing after a long day of exploring, but again, space wise having a really good shower was probably more practical. Decor-wise the rooms were typical Venetian OTT - purple and green striped wall paper, purple lamp shades, green duvet, purple head board, with a marble floor. Now, this might not be to everyone's taste, but it's fun and gives it a lot more character than some drab magnolia room. The service in general at the hotel was really excellent. Because there are only 12 rooms, the reception is never too busy, so you get a much more personal service than at a larger hotel. They were very helpful with restaurant suggestions (Venice is a restaurant minefield-finding the gems that aren't super expensive isn't easy!) as well as generally being friendly. After we overslept on the first morning and turned up 20 mins after breakfast was over, they were very accommodating, bringing us coffee and generally being cool, when in many places you would get a disinterested, passive aggressive "uh, breakfast is actually finished..." A special mention has to go to Kamal who was on reception at night. He was always very friendly and would always make us a lovely little selection of snacks when he brought up our post-dinner drinks. He was even kind enough to bring us up a bottle of Prosecco as a gift on our last night, which was very touching - as I've said, there's a level of personal service that is hard to beat. If I were going to criticise anything then I'd say that the cooked portion of the breakfast buffet wasn't great. Limp bacon, overdone scrambled eggs and cooling hard boiled eggs - just not quite up to scratch for a Brit who likes a cooked breakfast. However, the continental spread was decent and at the end of the day, it's included anyway so you can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Juanfrutos
Reviews.Content: An unforgettable stay and honeymoon in a delightful town. The hotel has a unique atmosphere, and the service was simply perfect. It was like being at home, a beautiful home. A special mention for Alessandro and Kamal. Thank you for making of this stay a chapter of a travel to always remember. Juan and Samira

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tanagra93
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this hotel because of its location in San Marco area, and because of the beautiful pictures of the bedrooms on the web site. We have not been disappointed at all : our bedroom was as beautiful as we had seen on the pictures, and very comfortable, with a beautiful view on the Canal and the back of the Fenice theatre. All the staff members are very available, polite, helpful, and always with chic and style. As the hotel is not so big, the staff can take time to give advice, to recommend some typic restaurants and bars, to personalize its approach with the clients. The hotel is located 5 mn maximum far from San Marco place, and very close to the luxury shops street. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel, and we do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Beautiful rooms, great location & excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: DGK22
Reviews.Content: This review comes in quite late but as I looked back at 2010 and reminisced about our fantastic trip to Italy, I realised that this hotel was one of the highlights of our vacation. We had booked the hotel based on the reviews and were delighted as it suprassed our already high expecations. We were upgraded to the suite, which was simply stunning. Being a boutique hotel, the personalized service makes the stay quite special. Many thanks to Beatrice and Kamal for all the gestures from the upgrade to the champagne & chocolates to the restaurant suggestions, all of which made AD Place one of the best places we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and still the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: cumi
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at AD Place was back in March 2010. It was then rated the No. 1 hotel in Venice. I vowed to return and even brought my children, my sister and her family as well! I don't understand how it could have gone down to No.17 in a few months. It is STILL the BEST! My family and my sister's family loved EVERYTHING about AD Place. My niece fell ill on the way to Venice and I emailed the hotel for some medical assistance. Doctor Marco was waiting for us. He was so kind to my niece. She ended up having to take the water ambulance to the local hospital, all arranged by the hotel. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly, kind, helpful and professional. Rooms beautiful! My sister had the Marzo family suite. It was spacious, warm and comfortable. Breakfast was the BEST so far in all the hotels we've stayed in Italy! Once again, my review would be: Beautiful rooms, Excellent location, Great breakfast, Value for money, Professional and helpful staff, Excellent for couples and families. My verdict? Still number 1 for my family and I. Thank you everyone at AD PLace, especially Massimiliano(we thought your name was Massimo). Sorry we missed you on our trip, Alessandro. Hope you like our gift and please use them!

Reviews.Title: “Youâ€™ll fall in love with this place!”
Reviews.Author: ld2677
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location but thankfully not in the middle of all the chaos. When we were dropped off by the ferry bus I was unaware that we had to drag our bags through the streets. The hard labor was all worth it because the hotel was amazing!! The lobby was so beautiful decorated that anyone who walked past it would stop and look in. The drapes and candles were especially lovely at night. The one thing to note is that there is no elevator so you have to go up 2 flights of stairs however; they do have a handicap elevator that is used to bring up your bags. When you get to the 3rd floor you will walk into the breakfast area. They have 4 tables up and when they are not being used at breakfast they have drapes hanging over them, it was very cool to look at. We ended staying in the purple room that is advertised on the website, and it did not let us down. The walls were covered in fabric instead of wallpaper which was an interesting touch.
