The most beautiful bedspread and pillows accented the beautiful chandelier. We overlooked the cannels and everyday we heard the gondolas singers go by, it was amazing! The hotel was very clean, and the staff was very helpful. There is a fabulous girl working at the front desk that helped us with everything, and never let us down with food request. On our last night Kamal (a very nice hotel employee) brought us champagne and goodies. It was a lovely surprise and made us even more depressed to leave this place. I work in NYC so I see boutique hotels all the time, and they arenâ€™t in the same league as AD Place. We really loved it here and hope you do too! BTW the breakfast is VERY good! Also, they have these amazing air fresheners throughout the place

Reviews.Title: “Venice...Wonderful Place - Wonderful Ad Place....”
Reviews.Author: bruce250
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a 4 day trip to Venice and the Ad Place hotel with my partner after arranging it as a surprise for her 40th birthday. I wanted to make the trip one to remember as my partner and i have always wanted to visit Venice. I used tripadvisor for the hotel advice and considered my choice very carefully, and i was not disappointed as the hotel was as good if not better than the reviews and the attention to detail by all the staff is second to none, from Kamal coming to find us at 10pm when we arrived and could not find the hotels location to helping me surprise my partner with roses, candles and champagne on the return to our room on the evening of her birthday, which all came as complimentary as did the upgrade to a superior room and then on the last night to a suite when there was an issue with the water system in the first room. This was all on top of all the great things the hotel offers as standard like the boutique feel, the great rooms and a great location. I would like to advise anyone considering a trip to Venice that Ad Place is a very special hotel with something money can not buy...great staff that really do care about their guests. Both my partner and I would like to give a big thank you to all the staff who made this a very special trip.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: DAGH2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with 2 other couples and we all enjoyed our stay. This hotel has an excellent location - very close to St. Mark's Square and excellent restaurants. The service was superb. All of the staff were very helpful with directions, restaurant reservations and hotel services. Special mention to Kamal for his hospitaility, especially for arranging to get us to the airport very early in the morning. He was even waiting outside our door to take the cases down from the third floor at 4:30am. His gentlemanly manner and careful attention to every detail of service (from drink preparation at the bar to timely delivery of snacks) made our stay extra pleasant. The 3rd floor room was quite comfortable and the breakfast and snacks available throughout the day were excellent. The decor is unique and quite fitting for a boutique hotel in Venice. The bathroom was large and well equipped. It was interesting to be on the canal and to hear the singing from the gondolas! Great place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sara_Ware
Reviews.Content: We booked at the AD Place after seeing all the recommendations on TripAdvisor and checking out the website. I'm glad to say that we weren't disappointed. The hotel is a lovely little jewel of a place wonderfully situated to see all the sights, but also quietly hidden on backstreet so you can get away from all the crowds. Being Italian and well experieced with the country's lax attitude toward hotel ratings I'm glad to say that the AD more than deserves its four stars. From the moment we arrived the service was excellent, and the room was always clean. We had quite a small room, but it didn't matter as it was a perfect size to flop out in after a long day sight-seeing. One word of warning though, the AD is based in an old Venetian house therefore it only has stairs for guests - no lifts; so it may not be an option for you if your mobility is impaired.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location..”
Reviews.Author: Koksal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in AD Place last week for 3 nights..The first day we got lost in Venice like many others..Then realized we are in the middle of St Marco and Rialto,two main squares.Many things are OK in AD place,except the elevator.Since there is no elevator!And mainly the rooms are at the 3rd floor.But still it is good to stay there.Specially Kamal is great guy trying to make your holiday better..One thing to do in Venice..You must see the perfect classical music band Lavena performing everynight at St Marco Plazza.Koksal Unlu/Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Just Delightful”
Reviews.Author: ItalyTrip2010
Reviews.Content: It was a little tricky getting to AD Place because our water taxi driver didn't know the name or even the address. He ended up dropping us off at the wrong number. However once we stepped inside the hotel our delightful experience began. Our room was the one you see on the website and overlooked a canal. We woke up each morning to the sounds of singing gondoliers. If I was looking for things to pick on then the breakfast is worth a mention. It was the probably the worst we experienced in our 5 weeks in Italy. It was still adequate and everything else more than made up for it. The staff were wonderful not only offering advice on where to eat and all those things but helping when it really counted. I left my backpack in the foyer one day and returned back to the hotel and found it safely in our room. They also carried our suitcases all the way to the grand canal when our water taxi was not able to pick us up from the hotel due to the rise in water level. We send out another thank you to Alessandro and all the staff for a wonderful stay. Canâ€™t wait to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be glad you stayed at "The AD"”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyshultz
Reviews.Content: After reading practically every review on Trip Advisor regarding a place to stay in Venice, my husband and I decided to book with AD PLACE. We chose this hotel because of the location and stylish decor. From the minute I contact the staff to make the reservation to the day we left the service level was unmatched. Beatrice and Alexandro, who ran the front desk during the day, were always so friendly and willling to help with directions, dinner recommendations, etc. We were met each night by Kamal who is so soft spoken and well mannered. He was eagar to ensure we were comfortable and happy durning our stay. The hotel even sent up a bottle of champagne for my birthday, which was extremely thoughtful. All in all we loved the city, the hotel, the staff and stay there again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected!”
Reviews.Author: dutchessnancy
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at AD Place last month and it was everything we expected! The rooms look just like the website and the staff were wonderful, always helpful. After our long flight from NY we were able to check-in a little early. It is located behind the new Opera house on a quiet canal, but close enough to many popular sights,San Marco, The Doge's Palace, The Academia and great shopping. We wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Women will love this place”
Reviews.Author: cruiser25
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights for my wife and me in November of 2009 in one of the slightly more expensive rooms based on tripadvisor reviews. We arrived around 7 or 8 pm and a reception for a local artist was in progress to which we were invited. My wife was super delighted both with the room and to be invited to the reception. We were assigned one of the two rooms on the ground floor. There is no second floor or next floor up. The other rooms are on the 3rd and 4th floors. Our room was really a small sitting room and a bedroom, both beautifully done up in all sorts of fabrics and pillows. Due to a storm the hotel's central heating was out and there was a space heater in the room. I'm a lawyer who does a lot of personal injury work and I have represented people burned in hotel fires. I noticed that the charming windows overlooking the canal had iron bars embedded in the ancient walls. Hmmm; lots of fabric, a space heater, and solidly barred windows. Was this first world Europe? I complained and was told that we could have unbarred higher level room the next day but there was nothing open that evening. My wife argued that the room was absolutely gorgeous, the building had obviiously been around for centuries and would surely outlast us and not be scene of a fire during our short stay. Further, she pointed out that both ground floor rooms opened very close to the main entrance: how long could it take to dash out to safety if there were a fire? I gave up worrying about the barred windows and enjoyed the stay. The breakfast fruits (breakfast is included) were picked with obvious care for sweetness and the hotel staff were extremely conscientious about answering our questions however detailed and helping me with a problem that developed with our return flight. Service is taken very seriously. (For what it is worth, bars on ground floor windows in Venice are extremely common and I didn't see any fire escapes.) The hotel has a great location, but the fact is that Venice is so small that unless you cannot walk comfortably, where in Venice proper that you are is not that important. Due to the fact that we visited off-season in cool weather made walking in Venice a pleasure. In fact, Venice, can be very magical in early winter: uncrowded, cool, and misty. Two off-beat places to visit are the Venice naval museum (Exhibit explanations in English) and what used to be its fleet mooring area. (Venice was once a great naval power.) It is currently run by the Italian Navy as a cadet dormitory and historical site. You can walk to them from the hotel if you like walking.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews - This place is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: CCButtons
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews are absolutely correct!! We recently stayed at AD Place Venice at the end of our 2 week honeymoon in Italy. We stayed in many different types of hotels, but this was our absolute favourite!! The decor of the room is absolutely beautiful and so unique. Where else could you stay in a place like this? (and how fitting that it would be in Venice) We stayed in the Aprile room. It is the one on their website in pictures12,14,15,19, 20 . It was so wonderful to open your window and see the gondolas going by and the gondoliers singing their songs. It was such a unique experience! Yes, the bathroom is little tiny, but it is definitely workable. The sink in the bathroom holds a little drawer that you pull out and keep all of your toiletries. When I got ready, I usually put my make-up on in the room as there are so many large mirrors on the closets. The staff were absolutely fabulous and helped us out with anything that we needed from booking reservations for us to checking us in to our flight online. We had the honeymoon package and candles were lit in our room and prosecco and snacks were brought up. It was totally romantic and they were so discreet about it. Kamal was so good about anything that we needed. We couldn't thank him enough. The price can be a bit intimidating (but it is Venice and everything is expensive!) but it is definitely totally worth it. I hope that we will be able to go back there one day!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: JimKCornerBrook
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within 10 minute walk to St. Mark's square. If travelling into Venice from train I recommend taking private water taxi as they will drop you at the door. The hotel room we had was very nice, it was large and roomy. It had a living room area with 2 sofa's. The bed was very nice. Breakfast was OK - no complaints. My wife really liked the unique decor of the rooms. There was a small roof top patio, but we only went up for a few minutes, as there was not enough time because so busy with everything else. We stayed 2 nights and really enjoyed the hotel, the location and Venice in general- two days was enough for us, we left from there to go on 7 day cruise then spent 2 days in Rome (where the Hotel was not nearly as nice)- over all I would recommend this place, becuase it was good location and the decor was nice for our Honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay and Exceptional Service for 5 Months Pregnant Lady”
Reviews.Author: chum88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. I was 5 months pregnant and this was our babymoon. The hotel accommodations were very comfortable from the nicely decorated room, attentive service, to excellent location. We stayed in the purple room (I can't remember the name of it, could be due to being pregnant). It was bigger than I imagined. The decor was typical Venetian but modern and updated. Being pregnant can be difficult to get around and sometimes late night hunger sneaks in but Kumal was extremely friendly and attentive bringing me fruit and my husband champagne. The location was awesome being so close to everything, San Marco, Rialto Bridge, the vaporetta, etc even a woman in my state had no problem getting to all the sites. Another plus was that the location of the hotel was tucked away from all the touristy foot traffic. The only negative thing I would say was that at the time of our stay, the bathroom door would not close. The lock on the door was pushed out and the key was missing. They tried to fix it but without another key there was nothing left to do. A minor issue to an otherwise amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and facility fantastic”
Reviews.Author: funexx
Reviews.Content: We were treated royally by all of their staff. They went out of their to help us at every turn. One staff member, Kamal, went well out of way to help us. We had to catch a 3:40 AM water bus to catch a 7:00 AM flight. In the middle of the night he made prepared breakfast for us and some food to take with. Even in the middle of the night he was pleasant and very attentive to our needs. The hotel itself more than surpassed our expectations. We particularly enjoyed spending time in the roof top area. We would not hesitate to return to Venice and stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Words can not describe such a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: PeacefulGlobe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married in Italy in the spring and spent two week on an Italian honeymoon. We stayed in Positano in Southern Italy, Rome, Florence, Pisa and Venice. Needless to say, we experienced many different types of hotel accommodations. I can say, without reservation, that the AD PLACE VENICE was best best hotel experience. There are many reasons we love this hotel. Decor: This hotel is very unique as you can see from the photos. Although the lobby is small, the inviting decoration draws you in and made us feel warm and comfortable after our long trip to Venice. The rooms are all uniquely decorated and original. No two rooms are the same. There was fresh fruit waiting for us in our room and the bed was amazing. Location: The hotel is just off the path of hight walking traffic so we were not disturbed by the many tourists running through the city. At the same time, we were able to walk to almost any area of interest. Service: Maybe I should have listed service first as it is the number one reason we would return or recommend this hotel to family. There was not a single opportunity where the staff missed the chance to go above and beyond expectations. We had a difficult trip into Venice so the staff offered use fruit, talked calmly and relaxed us, carried our bags up to our room before we even realized and then escorted us to the room while the desk clerk finished our check in process so we would not have to wait at the counter. As a special note, we would just like to thank Kamal for all he did in the early morning of our departure. Helping us with our "Heavy" bags. Getting us checked out FAST, explaining the water taxi service and then, when we missed the taxi, arranging a special water taxi to the airport!!! AMAZING SERVICE! If you are heading to Venice, you owe it to yourself to give this Charming hotel a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mktraveler1502
Reviews.Content: There is only one word to describe every aspect of Ad Place FANTASTIC, the staff make it, they are so knowledgeable and helpful a rare thing in todayâ€™s world. We noted that the Hotel was gay friendly so we booked, no need to worry they are an extremely welcoming Hotel to ALL. If you want a unique hotel experience try out the Ad Place , 10 mins walk max from all main sites. Hard to find initially on your first day so research the location well get advise from the hotel before you go. The adventure of locating the hotel adâ€™s to the whole fantastic experience. Head for the Opera house Teatro La Fenice the hotel is behind the opera house. Have a great say we did

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccomend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jambo53
Reviews.Content: After checking Tripadvisor on numerous occasions I chose the AD Place for our 2 night stay in Venice after our weeks cruise. I e-mailed the hotel prior to going and folowed their instructions on how to get there and found the hotel 2 minutes walk from vaporatta stop. Idealy situated for visiting all sights, 5 minutes easy walk to St Marks square and 10/15 minutes to Railto bridge. Hotel staff did recomend a few restaurants but we could not find them as it is very easy to get lost in Venice but previous reviews have stated these were good quality and cheaper. Hotel is lovely, we had the purple room on first floor overlooking the small canal where the gonodolas passed on a regular basis. Breakfast surprised us as you could get an amazing variety of freh fruit, breads, pastries yoghurts etc but also boiled eggs, scrambled eggs and bacon. Only thing I might suggest some back ground music as it is a smaller breakfast room and if yiou are sitting with only another couple you can hear a pin drop but this is only a suggestion and not ibn any way a negative comment on hotel. Staff all amazing including Kamal who brought a bottle of champagne and a tray of nibbles to our room on oir last night as we were celebrating an anniversary room and Allesandro on front desk. I did think the price was expensive , we paid Â£420 for 2 nights but not by Venice standards as overall Venice is a very expensive place to visit. Would highly reccomend this hotel for position, cleanliness, style and the servcie provided by all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, if a little querky”
Reviews.Author: NorthernWanderer0
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Venice. Decor a little odd. Small bathroom but functional. Excellent helpful staff. BUT - quite a few stairs, and no lift. There is an inclinator for luggage, but at the end of the day, the stairs can be daunting. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wondrous!”
Reviews.Author: PandGS
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms at AD Place after extensive research, I chose this hotel because of the fabulous reviews on Trip Advisor, the supurb location of the hotel and finally as a result of the email correspondence between myself and the hotel staff prior to making the booking . I had high expectations and was not dissaapointed by any aspect of our stay. For the 4 months prior to our visit, I had been planning a surprise birthday weekend for my wife. I secretly arranged with her family to meet them on the terrace in AD Place at 1pm on 10 September. I organised the surprise with Alessandro and Beatrice from AD Place who were simply brilliant with its execution. The surprise, and our stay at the AD Place could not have been any better. The hotel is positioned perfectly. Itâ€™s a stones throw from St Marks Square, Rialto Bridge, Dogeâ€™s Palace, the Peggy Gugenheim museum and many more attractions. The rooms of the hotel are luxurious and super clean and the staff could not do enough to ensure our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jess012345
Reviews.Content: We spend our honeymoon trip in Venice. The room was romantic & charming. The staff had provided us excellent service & are very helpful. In Venice, foods seems to be more expensive than other places in Italy; the staff had given us some good places for food. We loved the canal view of our room. The breakfast was excellent. As for location, we think it was close to most of the tourist site, such as the san marco square. As long as you follow the hotel instruction, the hotel is easy to find after getting off from the waterbus (around 5 min). Lastly, thanks to Kamal; he had given us the surprise with the room decorated with the rose petals & candles. It is a very romantic hotel. We highly recommend this hotel for honeymoon trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: MTG814
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the AD Place for the Venice leg of our Italian Honeymoon. The hotel was amazing romantic. They upgraded us to the suite and it was breathtaking. The decor is gorgeous and the canal views are to die for. Every evening and morning goldeliers drove by serenading their passengers. It was wonderful. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and they did a very nice breakfast. It is a wonderful hotel and worth the money. It is hard to find the first time, but once you find it you realize how easy it is. Map out directions before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Wrapped in Romance!”
Reviews.Author: kunkelpie79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ad Place Venice for a few nights to celebrate our 12th wedding anniversary and were overwhelmed by it's romantic charm, beautifully done rooms, amazing staff, great breakfasts and coffee/espresso, not to mention this hotels perfect location! It's quiet and tucked away from the hustle and bustle but just a short stroll to the heart of the city! The water bus is right around the corner too- which is fabulous! We love hotels and travel frequently and can honestly say that this was one of our most favorite hotel stays to date.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel , great experience”
Reviews.Author: Natarajan_Sankar
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed in AD place during our honeymoon when we visited Venice for 2 nights. The hotel is very close to the water bus stop though we took a while to locate it and needed some help the first time. The facade of the hotel is not very impressive but as soon as you enter inside you know that this is a hotel you will always remember. The rooms were a flight of stairs up where there is a great breakfast room surrounded by the rooms. The rooms are very unique and nice, a small canal flowing outside the windows. The breakfast spread was great. As part of our package we had a water taxi trip to Murano which was also great and the night manager got us a special tray of drinks on our last night there which made things all the more special. It was a great stay at AD place. Though we thought initially that it was a little overpriced, we were very happy with the choice of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Never go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmalA3
Reviews.Content: We reserved in this hotel and paid already our stay in advance . When we arrived to the hotel our planning had been changed . We asked to have 3 nights instead of 4 , the manager of the hotel , if i can give him this name, refused , saying that everything 's paid i cannot refund any money for you !!!! i work in a 5 stars hotel in Geneva, we do that refund easily. But he was afraid to loose money . that his hotel was very far and he will not find other guests like us . The service wan nul ,Zero nothing specil . There's more than 450 hotels in enezia, the city 's good but people aren't good .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: BnSG
Reviews.Content: After a very long day of traveling, we were very impressed with our arrival at AD Place. The atmosphere of the lobby during the evening is quiet and romantic. We stayed in Novembre our first night, but were upgraded to Marzo for the remainder of our stay. It was beautiful! St. Mark's is a 5 minute walk and the Ponte Rialto is about 10 minutes away. It was a little hard to find the hotel at first, but once you knew to look for the Fenice, it was very easy to find. The staff was more than helpful and accommodating. Great place to start our honeymoon! Would recommend to anyone traveling to Venice with a spouse.

Reviews.Title: “Romance!”
Reviews.Author: sexykazzie60
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is perfect! Perfect Location, Perfect room (September - amazing), perfect choice for breakfast, i can't say a bad word about it - ok so there were a lot of stairs - but how many times did we climb them in a day? Twice maximum - sometimes only once - would this stop us using this hotel again? Absolutely not! To go back in the evening and find the Reception area all candle lit was just beautiful..... we took a water taxi from the AIrport and were taken straight to the door of the Hotel - it was lovely....the location was so perfect.. literally round the corner to St Marks Square.. and within walking distance of everywhere.... Venice itself was so romantic with all the bridges, gondalas etc and this Hotel just made the whole experiance perfect for us... i hope we can stay here again one day.....every member of staff we spoke to was extremely helpful and altho maybe slightly extravagant - we had clean towels every time we used them! For us, another nice touch... altho not everyone would agree... i could go on and on about this hotel - we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way...”
Reviews.Author: thedigitalpro
Reviews.Content: Now I want to be totally honest here. I knew nothing about Italy, Venice or AD Place before I booked my wife's surprise(10th Anniversary) trip in July 2010. I used the trip advisor website to read reviews and decide which were my shortlist of hotels. I opted for AD Place just purely on some key factors from the reviews and these were location, favourable reviews and basically the pictures on their own website. So I was very much recommended from the web. The Room My experiences were based on a peak time stay over 3 nights (July 2010). We went for the Classic Double option at this hotel and I decided on the room called September which is situated on the top floor right next to the penthouse roof top terrace. If you want to relate the room name to the actual pictures on their own website then checkout pictures numbers 22,23 and 24. The room was cool, could hear a pin drop. looked and smelt lovely. Very purple theme. The bathroom was fine for us although the toilet was a little in the corner but reachable. Shower was a brilliant size. Can I add a note to say that this particular room does not have a window overlooking the canals but please don't let this put you off. I knew this in-advance of our stay and it never became an issue during our stay because most of the time you are out and about. If you need views then treat the roof top terrace as your balcony. There is a safe in the room which is free to use. Tap in your personal code and you are away. We had an ipod dock and controls to operate the velux electric blinds. Plenty of mirrors in the room. Breakfast Perfect. I feel there is plenty of choice to get you started on your day. Fresh oranges to squeeze your own juice and more fruit than you could shake a stick at. Cereals, scrambled egg on toast together, biscuits to name a few items. I could agree that perhaps a few additional items could be added but overall we were happy. Staff Fantastic. The staff at AD Place were the best we have ever experienced at any hotel we have been to in any country. In particular Beatrice and Kamal who we spoke to the most were excellent. Beatrice worked during the day and advised us on a few eating establishments. Meanwhile Kamal who worked during the night was brilliant too. He kindly provided a bottle of bubbly together with some snacks in our room on our first night. A lovely touch and made our evening after a long day. The other chappy who I cannot remember his name was also very welcoming when we briefly spoke. Hotel Overall We did not find the hotel difficult to find. Infact we walked directly to it. Just make sure you print off the map on their website and you will not have any trouble. It's perfectly located about 5 - 7 minutes walk to the main square. Nicely tucked away from the busy areas. Superb central location. Reception area is modern with local character and charm. It has all the mod cons including Wifi which did not cause too much problem although perhaps our room was furtherest from the routers which meant our connection, on occasions, was briefly interrupted. Not a big deal... Finally the stairs were not a problem. Yes there are a few flights but nothing to worry about. Luggage goes up on a chair lift so no humping about. Breakfast is served within the room below so hardly far to walk. Quick word on Venice including budgeting... Loads and loads of walking. Not cheap but then Europe is not at the moment. Expect to pay around 110.00 euro for a gondolier ride (ours was about 35 minutes). A good meal will be around 90 euro with soft drinks and the odd italian bear. 8 euro each for the trip up the Campanile tower in St Mark's Square. Temp in July for us was around 32 degrees with full Sun during our stay. Water taxi from Airport cost me 90 euro online before our trip. I paid 110.00 euro to go from the hotel to the airport for the return trip. We paid around 50 euro for a 48 hour Vaporetto pass for two people. Ice cream was fantastic. Best you could ever taste at around 2 euros each. Best value in Venice. Cheaper meals can be had a Burger King and McDonalds. One of each in Venice. I hope everyone finds this of use. Venice is great and thanks once again to AD Place for making our stay perfect with great memories.... Steven & Karen.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Ninn4
Reviews.Content: Stay here. Location fab, just behind the Fenice theater. Its close to everything and away from st. Mark,s. Loved staying here. Service was great, got upgraded the second night with snacks and champagne. Breakfast was great. i slept great. Highly recommended. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Remote and Quiet for Busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lookoutescapes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ad Place during our recent trip to Venice. The Hotel Staff was friendly and kind and worked with us to have a ground floor room since my husband was having back issues and steps were hard for him. We did enjoy our stay but there were certain things we would have liked to have seen. Breakfast was adequate but not amazing and required quite a few steps to get to the breakfast room. The hotel is quite modern and needs a few changes to make it more enjoyable. The bath vanity had no space at all for any toiletries and there was no where to place anything. This was a bit awkward. The shower was tiny and the door was very hard to open. It made showering a bit difficult. The decor was a bit modern for my taste but it was very nice if you are looking for that type of look. We were on a tiny canal and it was close enough to St. Marks square for an easy walk to all the sights of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the AD Place, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: elises22
Reviews.Content: We had a phenomenal stay at the AD Place. The rooms were clean, the breakfast was fantastic and the service was just excellent. We especially wanted to thank Kamal who helped us every single night during our stay. He really made us feel at home and we can't thank him enough for such great customer service. Our only hesitation in recommending the hotel is that it is a bit hard to find when you just arrive in Venice. That being said, once you do arrive, you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: piphimon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fabulous. The location in great. You can take a water bus directly to a stop about a block a way from the hotel. Get off on the Giglio exit, walk straight down what looks like a little alley then make a quick left. You wont have to climb stairs or anything- very convenient. The breakfast is pretty good and included in the price. the staff in very helpful and makes great recomendations regarding what to do and where to eat. They are very sincere. The only downside is the showers are on the small side. If you are on the bigger side you might encounter a problem.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely beautiful gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonOfEngland
Reviews.Content: Our last stop on our trip across Italy, and definitely our favourite hotel. Firstly, it is in a great location - really central, but not on a main tourist path. Easy to reach, but also quiet. Secondly, the actual hotel itself is incredibly beautiful and stylish. The reception area/communal area looks, and smells, wonderful. The reception staff are very friendly, and it is very atmospheric in the evening when they light all the candles. We were upgraded to a junior suite free of charge. The suite was superb - a large 'living room' area with an exercise bike and minibar, and then the main bedroom was large with windows on two sides. A very comfortable bed, good lighting, an iPod dock/speakers and rather strangely a TV attached to the ceiling over the bed (which actually works rather well). We had some small criticisms - for example, the shower door didn't close properly and we had to tune the TV in ourselves. But these were far outweighed by how charming the hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Romantic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holmonster
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are New Yorkers and are incredibly picky. We understand that European standards are a bit different then US standards, so we never expect much. This hotel FAR exceeded our expectations. The hotel is small and only has 12 rooms- each very different, very clean, and cute. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful - in fact, one of the hotel staff, Kamal, saw us come in late on our last night and brought us up a tray with snacks and champagne. The size of the hotel allows for them to truly give you a personalized experience. Hotel has small roofdeck area to go chill too- which we used every day. Location is great- walking distance to everything and is on a quiet street. Every morning I opened the shutters to hear and opera singer singing on the street- how fantastic! I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a boutique hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful and romantic”
Reviews.Author: dhakagirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Italy for our 25th anniversary with our 15 yr old daughter. Venice was our 3rd stop, after Rome and Florence. We stayed at the ADplace after reading all the wonderful reviews on trip advisor. And believe me they were not wrong. The hotel was wonderful, beyond our expectation. We were received with" happy anniversary" from Beatrice, front desk staff.. They had rose petals on the counter! We stayed in November, which was the junior suite on the first floor. The room was beautiful with a sumptous bed and a window overlooking the canal. The bathroom was clean and spacious, I thought. They insisted on bringing our luggage to our room, although we were on the first floor. The room had free wifi and ipod docking station, which made my husband and daughter very happy. Restaurant recommendations by Beatrice was great! But the best part of our stay was when the night receptionist Kamal was working. He was absolutely wonderful. WE were served champagne with little fruits and snacks on a silver platter with rose petals scattered on it in the most beautiful roof terrace . He gave us a choice of serving the champagne in our room or the terrace, and we chose the terrace. It was so romantic. He even made a special fruit cocktail just for our daughter. He was very helpful in helping us figure out how to get to the airport next day. He left chocolates for us in our room. We have stayed in many hotels, but have never felt so pampered like we did here. I would definitely go back there again. Staying in this hotel on the last part of our trip definitely made it an especially memorable anniversary trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leicester77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ad Place for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon - I have to say the hotel is a gem - great location in venice walking distance to everything & great staff! - The staff at teh hotel really made our stay they made us feel so welcome and they made our honeymoon so special - I have to say Kamal behind the front desk went beyond his duty to make it a stay we will never forget - great help, great restaurant recommendations but especially the rose petals, champagne & candles in our room was such a romatic suprise. The room was excellent - as was the roof terrace - breakfast there was more than enough to eat. You'll be made very welcome here! - Its second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the acclamation”
Reviews.Author: JimmyD613
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Venice with my wife at the end of May, 2010. Like so many others, we had booked the Ad Place based largely on the recommendations from TripAdvisor, and our expectations were met on all counts. We were given the September room, which is up on the top floor right beside the rooftop terrace. The room was a 'Standard double' room - so their basic offering. It was very nicely decorated, clean and well thought out. Everything in the hotel is new, it had only been open a year at the time we visited. Only drawback - and this did not impact us at all - is the hotel's lack of elevators. If you don't like (or have trouble with) walking stairs, you may want to request a ground floor room. Breakfast was nice, nothing fancy, but sufficient to build up energy before a long day of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Jaybird9520
Reviews.Content: If I was only allowed to say one thing of my time at AD Place it would that the service was exceptional. It was so wonderful we wanted to take the staff home with us, especially Kamal. When you first walk in to AD Place you are greeted by candles upon candles and decadent looking fabrics. At night they light all the candles and the hotel glows so softly. We arrived there after almost 12 hours of travel and a six hour time difference. We were greeted by Alessandro and he was very gracious and welcoming. He showed us this exquisite gem of a hotel and got us settled in our room. Our room was April, one of the superior rooms and it was spacious. We had a beautiful canopy bed two well appointed armoires and a gorgeous colour palette. It looked like a fancy French confectionary or my childhood dream come to life. Our bathroom was on the small side but more than adequate and had plenty of hot water. After unpacking and showering we spent a little time gazing out our window to the canal. We went back downstairs for a quick chat with Alessandro for recommendations for lunch and we went exploring. That night on my arrival back to our room a single long stemmed rose awaited me. The next morning we were ready for breakfast. It is not a huge breakfast (nor am I a huge breakfast eater), there was American style coffee, espresso, tea, water, fresh squeeze it yourself orange juice and water. Eggs were available as was toast, yogurt, and a variety of pastries and fruit. The setting was lovely. The food was adequate, but was perhaps the only thing that could use a little improving. On our return the next evening we met Kamal. I think Kamal was born to be in the hotel business. Never have I had anyone so concerned that I was attended to. When I was offered a lovely glass of Prosesso it was never just handed to me in a glass, rather, it came with little treats and the presentation was everything. There was no request too big or too small that we could make to Kamal that did not get met. In fact he anticipated our needs and went beyond our expectations. We were treated to two bottles of champagne on our stay (we stayed 7 nights) and we drank one on the lovely terrace and the other we enjoyed in our room listening to the canal outside our window. On the day we left, we checked out and much to Alessandroâ€™s horror we carried our own bags to the front desk. He expressed that had he known we were on our way down, he would have gladly given us a hand. He kindly checked us onto our flights and arranged a water taxi to the airport for later that night. He was also kind enough to store our bags, so that we could enjoy an extra few hours in Venice before heading to the airport. We arrived back to the hotel about 15 minutes before our water taxi and Kamal insisted we remember this moment with another glass of prosecco. We were not allowed to carry our bags out the door, as Kamal preferred we enjoyed our drinks while he took care of loading the bags. Before sending us off, Kamal presented me with two long stem roses. Things we enjoyed about the hotel: SERVICE, dÃ©cor, comfortable bed, atmosphere, and location (five minutes through high end boutiques to get to St Markâ€™s Square). Things we did not enjoyâ€¦.Going Home. We have never been so sad to leave a hotel. Everyone should get to experience this spectacular service from this hotel. A MUST for a trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ny721
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy and are very glad we stayed at Ad Place while in Venice. We passed lots of outdated/run-down looking hotels in town and were glad we paid some more to stay here. It's conveniently located to San Marco square, yet set back from the noisy crowds on a little side street. The service was great - Beatrice and Kamal were especially helpful - and there were nice touches, like champagne, berries and nuts at bed time, and coffee and fruit available all day out in the breakfast room. The room was immaculately clean and smelled nice, like lemons. Only downside was that the Wi-fi was acting a little wonky from our room while we were there, but it always worked in the lobby. But great hotel, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff - Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohawk1975
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend with the Wife during Valentine's and the Carnival so prices were expected to be high. Ad's Place is a small nicely decorated little hotel situated in a quiet location away from the hussle and bussle yet in walking distance from St Mark's Square where all the action is. The staff were extremely polite and tried to help when they could. The rooms were clean and well kept. Breakfast they struggled a bit with sufficient seating when it got a bit busy - but if you start early this wouldn't be a problem. Overall, this is a cosy hotel which is well kept with friendly staff in a good central quiet location. Prices are not cheap but fair for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, had a great time there on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HK_worldtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in AD Place. It was the first stop of our Europe honeymoon trip. The hotel was modern, clean, and spacious, which you would not find easily in Venice with this price. The staffs were all friendly and helpful. They orgainised champagne and deco because they knew it's our honeymoon. We like everything about this hotel. The location was good and quiet. It is well worth to pay the price for this quality. This was the 4th time I stayed in Venice and surely the best hotel ever. The other 3 hotels I stayed was a little cheaper but all with terrible experience. I will suggest to pay more for a good hotel like this one and save up on food and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “We had such a wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyTravel6
Reviews.Content: I walk away from this hotel feeling very indulged. The attention to detail really made our stay so special - the complimentary chocolates in the room; the mojitos in the afternoon; the rose left on our bed on the day of our wedding anniversary; the complimentary champagne presented on a silver tray scattered with rose petals... Aesthetically, the hotel itself is immersed in this attention to detail. It is a blend of bohemian and traditional; funky and baroque. We stayed in the October room, which together with the grand interior and the space, made us feel like royalty. The roof terrace was a romantic delight. I love the feel of this boutique hotel. It is sexy and charming and everywhere you look your eye is in for a treat. The staff were absolutely wonderful. They were incredibly attentive, friendly and efficient. Alessandro at reception was our first contact. He made us feel very welcome, and was very helpful with everything from tips on restaurants to advice on how to be 'street smart' in Venice. However ALL the staff we came in contact with were very pleasant and helpful including the staff person at breakfast and the night clerk (sorry didn't get your names). Breakfast was a continental buffet with fresh juices, fruits, cakes (loved the custard filled donuts) as well as the usual European delicacies. Location wise, we couldn't have asked for a more convenient spot. About a 5 minute walk to St Marks Square and about a 2 minute walk to the vaporetti/ACTV rendering you close to all the attractions. But one tip I would offer is that if you are able to walk, you really don't need the services of the vaporetti. Everything is very very close and walking around gives you the opportunity to explore and discover (oh, and get lost over and over). Besides, at 6.50 Euro a ride per person, it can get very expensive. On the downside for this hotel, is the unavoidable noise produced by the men collecting garbage in the morning. Thankfully it wasn't too early and most mornings we were awake anyway. The other thing to be aware of is that there is no elevator in the hotel. We did not have a problem with the stairs, but if I were to bring my mother here, for example, I would request a room that doesn't require so much of a hike. In sum, we found our visit to Venice was enhanced by staying at the AD Place hotel. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world, but never have we felt so pampered as we did here. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I look forward to one day going back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctorST
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the AD Place in Venice. We chose the hotel from the Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel is situated minutes away from St Marks Square and ideal as a base for exploring the city. We stayed in the Maggio room which has a view onto the canal below. The room was great withthe passing gondoliers serenading us. service was excellent Kamal in particular was a star, very helpful and made the visit special. We had the champagne package which is definitely worth doing. Thanks AD Place for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with superb personalised service.”
Reviews.Author: LondonEurohopper
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through TripAdvisor. After a four-night stay I can confirm that the hotel deserves the excellent reputation that it has earned. My family of 5 was visiting Venice for the first time. My spouse and I have three children, aged 9, 7 and 4. We booked the hotel's junior suite (called the "November" suite), which has a sitting room (converted for us into a sleeping room with a high-quality sofabed), and a larger bedroom with a large and comfortable bed. There was a small but impeccably clean bathroom with a shower (no bathtub). The furniture, room fixtures and bed linens were of luxurious quality. The suite is on the ground floor of the hotel with several windows looking out onto a small canal. The entire hotel was extremely clean, in an old building refurbished to very high standards of quality and design. The location is excellent: nestled in a quiet and clean part of central Venice, an easy walk from most major sights. It is a relatively small hotel, with I believe only 12 rooms. The size of the hotel gives it an intimate charm and exclusivity, especially thanks to the superb personalised service of the small staff. Upon arrival we were greeted by name by Alessandro, who gave us welcome beverages as we checked in and discussed our needs and preferences. Upon my request prior to arrival, Alessandro had arranged to have a huge bouquet of flowers waiting for my wife in the suite. Over the 5 days of our stay Alessandro was cheerful and helpful, giving excellent advice and making us feel at home. The night concierge, Kamal, always welcomed us warmly after long days out sightseeing, with complimentary refreshements and fresh fruit or nuts or other light snacks, and he was efficient and responsive whenever we had any requests. The breakfast is a self-service buffet with a good variety of options. There is an espresso machine and a citrus press, various other beverages, pastries, cold cheeses and meats, fresh fruits, bread, and on most days there was a big heated pan with additional hot choices (eggs, meats, etc.) The breakfast buffet of course does not rival buffets of major 400-room hotels, but it has plenty of choices. For restaurants we either followed the excellent recommendations of Alessandro, or went to some off-the-beaten-path places that had been recommended by friends. Wi-fi in the hotel was free, and accessible via a passcode obtained from the receptionist. All in all AD Place was an excellent choice for our stay. The room prices are reasonable for Venice, and excellent value for the discerning traveler willing to spend a bit more for real quality. In my view it is far better to stay here and benefit from the exceptional quality of the establishement and its personalised service, rather than get standard or poor service at overpriced competitors or the major hotel chains, which might be a bit less expensive. Venice is a unique and historic location, and in my view our choice of hotel was a big factor in contributing to an unforgettable week there. We will certainly return to AD Place and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TampaJulian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and our first stop was Venice. I used several sites to help guide me to the best values in Venice, Florence, and Rome. Based on the reviews already submitted, I felt that AD Place was a good bet. I WAS NOT wrong. We had a little trouble finding it at first based on were our water taxi dropped us off on arrival (that and the fact that locals weren't too familiar with the place since it's only about a year old), but once we did find it, we were very impressed. The decore was very contemporary and the staff truly went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed. Everything in the room was very clean and screamed luxury. It was a quick walk to St. Mark's Square (about 5 minutes) and not too far from the Rialto (about 15-20 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe Crawford
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at AD Place. Had a wonderful eclectic room and great staff. Very quiet. Breakfast was very nice. We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jj39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple spent 3 delightful days at this charming hotel. From the minute we checked in to our departure the service we recieved from the staff was the best I have ever experienced. Beatrice, Allessandro, Kamal, Andrew all provided a service that exceeded most 5 Star Hotels. The hotel is quiet but conveniently located to the highlights. The rooms are charming and so quiet we could sleep with our window open. The lounge area where breakfast was served is also a great place to gather with friends and other guests. Coffee and snacks are available 24 hours. Breakfast was very good. Very typical Italian breakfast. I loved the custard donuts which is a Venetian delight!! We were here the first week-end the Volcano erupted and we witnessed this staff treating the stranded guests as if they were in their own home. Thank you all for a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place is right”
Reviews.Author: CWhiteAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Venice is a great destination - and we found this hotel to be a prefect for us. Especially in this town where is is hard to find any "deal" on anything. It has a convenient location - not far from San Marco and the action but also very quiet and sweet. Everything in the hotel is new - which is hard to find anywhere in Europe. We stayed one night before our cruise and were given a tight but new and trendy room. The lack of elbow room was worth the great customer service, location, and comp breakfast. We liked it so much that we came back for two more nights after our cruise. Staff gave us excellent suggestions for dinner along with a huge first floor room with a tv on the ceiling. This hotel was the perfect beginning and ending to a fabulous vacation!

Reviews.Title: “very nice--no elevator”
Reviews.Author: shac1968
Reviews.Content: adorable hotel---really cool rooms---and spotless. staff is friendly and have great recommendations for restaurants. my only problem was that we reserved a terrace room months in advance and even e-mailed them a week before to confirm it but when we got there it wasn't available. we were given a beautiful suite instead but it still wasn't what I requested and I wasn't given much of an explanation. breakfast was pretty limited but adequate. the location was absolutely perfect---quiet but 5-10 minutes walk to all the action at St Marks square. like everyone says---the stairs are tough but good to work off all the food you've been eating.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & friendly”
Reviews.Author: manlytango
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay for our wedding. Convenient but quiet location. Very stylich decor (candlit reception in the evenings!). Everyone was friendly and helpful; and minor problems were sorted immediately. We'll certainly stay again on our next trip to Venice

Reviews.Title: “When in Venice, stay at AD PLACE, you will thank yourself later”
Reviews.Author: DivaTravelista
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beyond what you could ask for in any hotel. PROS: 1. Service is without fault, best service in any hotel we have ever stayed and believe me we love to travel. 2. Beautifully decorated, we were told our room was very romantic, boy was that an understatement, never seen a room like it 3. Breakfast is complete, light as you would expect in Italy. And coffee/biscuits/small cakes are available for you during the entire day. 4. PERFECT location, near everything, we didnt even purchase vaporetto passes as we preferred to walk everywhere 5. did I mention the service (special thanks to Alessandro, Helenora (sorry if I misspelled), and Kamal, the reason we felt so at home and welcomed even at midnight after a late dinner in Venice. ) 6. Free WiFi 7. Awesome Mojitos! CONS 1.Lots of stairs, ok for us really, but saw a few folks complain, maybe if elderly or just tired. Summing it up this hotel is absolutely BEAUTIFUL, our room, September, located in what was the attic of the original house was decorated to perfection with original exposed wood beams with modern touches such as rain shower and electrically opened ceiling windows. Before leaving I called the hotel to setup a few dinner reservations and Alessandro, the hotel manager, could not have been any more helpful. He suggested several and made reservations for dinner, and offered champagne on the terrace before dinner for my husband's birthday. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Helenora who was an absolutely gem. She was always so friendly and helpful during our entire stay. After a long night we were always met at the door by Kamal, the hotel night manager, who without fail made us feel like we were arriving back at our own personal home. He brought us champagne and snacks and anything we would ask for it was in our room within minutes, and believe that was a feat considering the stairs he had to climb to get there (as part of the original building there is no elevator, the stairs are one of those original features that we ended up having a love/hate relationship with...love for the originality and traditional feel, and well dislike for the workout :) ) Overall we are telling all of our family and friends that when in Venice stay at AD PLACE, no point in risking a subpar hotel experience when AD PLACE is the cherry on top of a beautifully unique city. Tell them The Lavinier's sent you!

Reviews.Title: “staff made our extended stay (due to volcanic ash) wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: bobobeens
Reviews.Content: my husband and i along wih another couple were scheduled to spend 2 nts at the Ad Place after a cruise to Greece.... due to volcanic ash in iceland our flts were cancelled and we were unsure how long we would have to stay.... a 2 night stay became 6 nights, and because of the exceptional staff - Alessandro, Beatrice, and Kumal - we had a frustrating situation made very pleasant....... they were extremely helpful with train reservations, airline info, city info, ect.... and always with a smile..... the breakfast (included in price) was very good - a nice assortment of food, very well presented, and a smiling staff member to help if needed..... every evening guests are presented with a red rose for their room - such a nice touch..... snack were offered as well and delivered with a smile.... we can't thank the staff for making us feel so welcome, we have told many of our friends about our special place in venice - . if you are looking for a boutique type hotel with excetional service the Ad Place is for you !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: randi_berry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first leg of our honeymoon at AD Place. We were so thrilled with this great hotel. The location was perfect, right off of a water bus stop and area for taxi's and gondolas. When we arrived we were upgraded to a very large one bedroom suite free of charge because it was available. The front desk was incredibly helpful in finding us places to eat and giving directions to the neighborhoods and sites we wanted to see. Kamal was especially doting. We had gotten the honeymoon package for ourselves but he went above and beyond. We were given champagne and snacks on more than one occasion. He even brought roses up to us one day. The entire staff was helpful and nice and went out of their way to make us comfortable. If we find ourselves in Venice again, we will for sure stay at AD Place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but good location”
Reviews.Author: jmlf
Reviews.Content: We were at AD 8th April for a few days. Positives Great location Fun quirky decor, lovely beds and rooms (if you don't take the economy ones) Pretty breakfast room Sweet reception staff. Negatives No proper coffee at breakfast ( in Italy!!) Breakfast food variable No proper bar, just mini bar with tumblers in room Not good if you can't climb stairs Expensive for what you get No info about hotel so it was only by exploring that I found lovely rooftop balcony

Reviews.Title: “A real Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: trishwint
Reviews.Content: A great location and very Venetian decor, the lobby alone is a marvel of rich fabrics and a very striking gold sofa. The staff were helpful-despite the day manager having an injured foot-Get Well Soon! All the staff spoke impeccable English, and were very attentive, and knowledgable about places to go. We stayed in the Aprile Room, a superior double on the same floor as the breakfast room. It was decorated in lilac and green, with a lovely view if the canal and the back of the Venice Opera House, and regular gondoliers.There is no lift, so be prepared for stairs (although there is a stairlift fitted). Breakfast was plentiful, with a juicer for squeezing fresh orange juice. Coffee and tea available all day. I would point out that there is no guarantee a superior room will mean free wine, although when we ordered (@20 euros!), it was brought to our room promptly with free nibbles. Pluses-Location, decor, view from room, service and friendliness of the staff, and check out restaurants nearby, some real gems at reasonable prices. Minuses-Bacon and eggs at breakfast in an unheated serving tray, but not much else to complain about. Had a wonderful stay, able to walk around so much of Venice in a couple of days, but bring your walking shoes. A really enjoyable stay and a proper Venetian gem.

Reviews.Title: “FENOMENAL”
Reviews.Author: bosgold007
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor I was worried that our expectations would be too high but I needn't have worried at all. This was our fifth trip to Venice, our favourite place in the world, but the first time we stayed at AD PLACE. We shall never stay anywhere else and I can't wait to go back. alessandro and his team were wonderful.The room was great, lots of details such as the Ipod station, the Deco is also great and its really well cleaned. Thank you Ad place for such a memorable engagement, and hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 star hotel that falls down on service”
Reviews.Author: DQC76
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4-day trip to Venice over Easter weekend. I can confirm comments from others that Venice is EXPENSIVE .... though i was prepared, it was really quite shocking We stayed in a junior suite on the 1st/4th floor ... think it was the Maggio room. The hotel has 2 rooms, which must be tiny & unfavourable on the ground floor, then you need to walk FOUR flights of stairs to get to the "1st floor", where there is a main room for breakfast/dining with 8 rooms situated off this room. 2 more rooms (large suites i think) are up another level Positive: - good size room with modern decor & great loft space ... ceilings were 11-12 feet with exposed beams - lovely windows that opened onto the Canal - location was perfect ... 5-10 minute walk to Piazza San Marco, yet not so close that you are suffocated by the crowds. Immediately adjacent to the opera - i liked the 24 hour acces to coffee machine & snacks - place was kept up properly & overall good housekeeping - iPod stereo system in the room was very welcome Negatives - the staff was not effective or helpful ... - Internet was down the entire trip (even thogh i called twice to confirm they had internet) - each time i asked about the problem, they pretended to be confused OR lied - asking them about dinner/spa recommendations OR how to get opera tix was a waste of time (again, the internet would have been helpful) - when i was meant to speak to the manager, i was kept waiting for over an hour (whilst he was sorting other guests whose reservation was LOST) - also not keen on the bathroom ... very narrow & the plumbing system (which may be a "charm" of Venice) made a terrible sound - given the cost, i just dont see any value (though this is true of Venice in general) Bar or restaurant would have been nice ... though you should be aware of what you are getting before you go ... if i went back to Venice, i would stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to say disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: pinkdicko
Reviews.Content: I was expecting luxury and Venetian style, but for the price i paid feel slightly ripped off - there wasn't even a proper window in our room (just a dorma & velux), and the air conditioning unit (placed annoying next door to us) combined with the light sensors (2 of them) that flashed all night causing a very fitful first nights sleep. Not what you would expect from a pricey 4*. I would have rather paid Â£500 more and said in the Gritti or Luna Baglioni. I did however find the location of the hotel convenient (once we had found it). Sorry for the disappointing review, but i don't want others to be misled like i was by the other reviews on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel, great location, some issues...”
Reviews.Author: PMTravel19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location and is nestled in a more quiet area of the city. The decor is brash and trendy. According to the pictures of the rooms on the hotel's website, I was expecting a decor that cleverly mixed new and cool with an old-world elegance. However, our room completely lacked old-world charm and completely focused on appearing trendy. The wallpaper was striped in black and gray, which would have looked great in a magazine, but was slightly unnerving over an extended period of time. The size of the room, however, was reasonably spacious. Our quality of sleep was decent with the exception of a slightly hard mattress and pillows. We also were awakened in the middle of the night by rather loud nocturnal activities (to put it politely) occurring in the room above us. The complimentary breakfast buffet was lovely, with the exception of the scrambled eggs that appeared burned and rubbery. Everything else was perfect. The staff would prepare wonderful cappuccinos upon request. The breakfast room was very nice and bright. The hotel offers coffee and tea to guests throughout the day. Be forewarned that if you read reviews about complimentary prosecco and snacks, these items are only reserved for those who book superior rooms. The front desk staff were all extremely accommodating and helpful. Overall, my husband and I found Ad Place to be a nice hotel, but not quite worth the price. Venice, however, is an extremely expensive city in general. Despite this, we greatly enjoyed Venice and were captivated by it's quiet, aged beauty. We would advise visiting during the "off" months when it is not so touristy or warm.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good..., but location is great”
Reviews.Author: Tipfromme
Reviews.Content: Instead of numbers, the twelve hotelrooms in this hotel are named after the months of the year. We stayed here for two nights; one night in the February room (classic double, however the staff referred to it as the economy room) before we were upgraded to the November room (junior suite) on the second night. Even though we appreciated the kind upgrade, we did not find any of the rooms THAT good. The February room on floor 1 (above ground floor) was nicely decorated with purple, green and pink fabrics. However, the room was absolutely tiny! Even the staff more or less excused the small size of the room when we first checked in. I would guess that the bed was about 1.40 m wide, and we kind of got the feeling that we were staying in a dorm room. This room was also situated next to the breakfast area and passed the shared toilet, which just didn't help. However, I understand that people can see this room as cute, and it would be ok for one person. The November room on the ground floor was quite big. This room was mainly decorated with black and grey, and with an orange/yellow bathroom, a blue sofa and a red carpet. In our view not a nice decoration, but on the other side a fairly modern and nice room. However, our main issue with this room was the location on the ground floor next to a bridge. People could not only look straight into the room, but there was also quite a lot of noice from people walking by (especially when they drag their suitcases over the bridge). Also, the wireless internet did not work properly in this room, and the staff was not able to fix it. I think we would have been quite dissapointed with this room if we had booked a junior suite. However, some of the other rooms on the wedsite look really nice, so other rooms may be better... Apart from the rooms, here is what we think: â€¢ The location is great for all the main attractions! â€¢ The breakfast was not very good (no fresh bread), but great orange juice. â€¢ Service was very on and off. Some were great, others had very little knowledge about the city, transport, restaurants etc. One girl with short black hair (cannot remember her name) was great:) â€¢ The cleaning seemed to be good, however on the day we left we noticed that they used the shared toilet as temporary storage for sheets and towels, which didn't seem very hygenic. Also, the use of scents and air fresheners in this hotel is a bit over the top (would prefer at least the bedrooms to smell just fresh and clean). â€¢ Terrible drainage in the sinks, however the showers were ok. This review may seem a bit harsh, as AD Place is an ok hotel for a break in Venice. However, we didn't find the great hotel we expected, and have stayed in many far better hotels for the same price in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “What a Place!”
Reviews.Author: Arelos4
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th annual 'pilgrimage' to Venice and we arrived with our two other couple friends for a 3 night break intending to celebrate my wife's birthday. We were warmly greeted by Alessandro and we were then shown to our room. Lovely sumptuous colours, fabrics and oh what a bed!! The biggest and most comfortable bed we have slept in for years!! We had the Maggio room which overlooked the small canal out the front which had a regular procession of gondolas and singing gondolieri passing by! The defining moment came when we heard Vivaldi coming from our friends' room next door on the iPod docking station that is supplied in each room (take your ipods or iPhones). Lovely old period furniture, a big fat shower head that soaked you, we really can not fault the rooms in any way! In the evenings the reception area was illuminated by candles and rich coloured fabrics hung from the walls, everyone that walked past on the street stopped to look inside. A big THANKS to Kamal the night manager who supplied us with a constant stream of tasty nibbles with our drinks and on the second night set up the Altana with a fantastic view right over the terracotta roofs to the Santa Maria della Salute..I'm sure he thought we were mad sitting up there in March!! The breakfasts were delicious (pastries, plum cakes, fresh fruits, scrambled egg and bacon, fresh breads condiments) and the coffee was to die for. An endless supply of coffee and believe it or not...tea, from the Segafredo coffee machine upstairs! All in all a fantastic, clean and ideally positioned hotel with friendly, helpful staff. We are so going back again....soon! Thank you to everyone that made our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - with caveats”
Reviews.Author: Terence1809
Reviews.Content: AD Place is in a great location, 5 minutes fro St Mark's and the same from the St Giglio Vaporetto stop. In fact, sitting in the back of the Vaporetto as you travel the length of the Grand Canal from P. Roma station is an excellent introduction to Venice and affords almost all the photo opportunities you might need. You could almost turn around and fly straight back and you'd have all the pictures you need to fill your Facebook "Been To Venice" album. The Hotel nestles in a quiet corner by a bridge overlooking the back of the Teatro Fenice opera house (where Angelina Jolie was filming during our stay!). We arrived early evening and having read all the previous reviews we were rather excited at the prospect of a complimentary glass of prosecco and some nibbles. Huge disappointment. This quite lovely courtesy is only extended to those staying in the superior rooms. Even when we asked if we could buy two glasses of prosecco we were told we couldn't as we'd have to buy a whole bottle. While the hotel is beautifully decorated and the bathrooms nicely appointed, our bedroom was absolutely tiny. The hotel also has plumbing issues - the noises of everybody else's showers, baths and loos flushing kept us awake - as did the clanging in the next door kitchen. Breakfast was lovely, a buffet served in a charming dining room with bacon, eggs, a lovely coffee machine and custard doughnuts to die for. Chatting to fellow guests and whiling away a few half hours over an espresso and croissants, or thumbing through the guide books planning what to see, do and eat was a relaxing and pleasant way to start the day. The biggest caveat is for the city herself - sadly past her best, shabby at the edges and in need of a good scrub and polish, Venice is almost a theme park. Were it not for the tourists in the gondolas, in Cafe Florian and in Harry's Bar these would not exist as there is no reason for them to be. Venice is a glamourous lady of a certain age - beautiful and elegant but expensive and past her best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: cumi
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with the hotel based on the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. Excellent choice! My husband lost his luggage on the Alitalia flight and was cold and grumpy when we arrived at the hotel. Allesandro, the hotel manager, was there to greet us and was so kind to upgrade us at no extra cost. It is small touches like these that go a long way. The location, the service, the room, the huge breakfast buffet etc...everything was just PERFECT!!! Look no further...stay here! I'm already planning my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wow i would stay here forever!”
Reviews.Author: chuckrutKnoxville_TN
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door until the time we left this hotel catered! Everyone who worked at this hotel were fabulous! They were so helpful and so dedicated towards making your stay an absolute wonderful experience. I would recommend this place to anyone and would def. stay here if I ever get the opportunity to visit Venice again! Wow! Thanks Kamal! You were so helpful! We loved our nice champagne and snacks!

Reviews.Title: “Weâ€™d come here again and again and againâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Flumpsy
Reviews.Content: Small but perfect! Weâ€™ve just returned from a 3 night break in Venice, and weâ€™re lucky enough to stay at the AD Place. We arrived a little early and our room wasnâ€™t quite ready, so we dropped off our bags and headed for a local restaurant, which was recommended by the check-in staffâ€¦..after a fantastic lunch of local seafood and wine we staggered back to the AD Place looking forward to an afternoon snooze. We were whisked up to our â€œroomâ€� to find weâ€™d been upgrade to a sumptuous suite, laic velvet and glass chandlers, roll top bath, huge lounge, 2 flat screen TVâ€™s, Playstation, iPod dock, 2 fully stocked fridges, coffee on tap and a four poster bed â€“ we never wanted to leave. The staff we helpful, knowledgeable and very friendly, and we were of course treated by Kamal on our first night to a cold bottle of champagne and nibbles. Allesandro the manager was so helpful (and not bad on the eye!) and made us feel so welcome. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel; weâ€™ll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “perfect, perfect, perfect”
Reviews.Author: Queenie38
Reviews.Content: Having checked the reviews on Trip Advisor I had high expectations - however these were exceeded on every level. The hotel is beautiful, the colours, the decor ,the styling all wonderful, luxury/ modern/ traditional comfortable and glamourous all at the same time! Location wise it's divine; directly behind the Opera House with a canal directly in front of the hotel- We seemed to be very well placed for all the key sight seeing locations and the best restaurants and shopping. It's no wonder so many people mention the staff - even before we arrived they were offering 5 star service recommending, then booking restaurants for us, then on arrival helping with directions, advice on travel, booking taxis not to mention the complimentary 'night caps' and snacks and fresh roses from the house keeping team. This is the first time i've written on Trip advisor - but the staff earnt every compliment - so thanks to Alessandro, Tanja , Beatrice and of course Kamal - the best night manager we've ever experianced. we look forward to our next stay with you ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: 1stClassAdventurer
Reviews.Content: This place was too good to be true! It's a new hotel and there were no reviews for Ad Place so I was taking a big risk when I booked. I almost wish I were not writing this since I want this place to be kept a secret. The decor is modern Venetian and I loved it! We went to Venice for the Venice Carnival and attended Il Ballo Del Doge so we planned to be in a good location. This place was perfect! 4 minute walk from St Mark's Square and the Grand Canal, plus it is located away from the main walkways and crowds. In fact there were no crowds or people ever around the hotel even at the peak time of the carnival! It is located next to a small canal with a pretty bridge. My room was HUGE although I got a suite for a good deal! I booked and paid 5 months in advance and was able to get a discount as a result. The hotel is very small and quaint making it easy to enter and leave. It is an old Venetian palace and due to its heritage and design there is no elevator but the 2 flights of stairs to the room is not a problem. There is no restaurant at the hotel but there are many good places nearby that the staff is happy to recommend. Breakfast is a basic continental breakfast but good, and you can squeeze the fresh blood orange juice yourself! Another nice touch is that every evening there are delicious gourmet chocolates and glasses of champagne left in reception for guests to take up to their rooms. Staff provided excellent service always even during the night and were very efficient with booking taxis and restaurant reservations for us. The bed sheets and pillows are 5 star hotel quality!! I had one of the best sleep experiences ever! I hurt my foot walking around Venice and needed some medication. I asked the staff for the nearest pharmacy and instead they gave me a whole bag of first aid goods to use and told me to keep it! I had a package that was due to arrive while I was staying there but it arrived two days after I left. The staff were kind enough to have it sent to my home address and did not even charge me for the postage. They simply said it was a pleasure to have us as guests. Now I want to return to Venice not just to see the city but for the hotel and staff experience at Ad Place. Thank you Beatrice and all at Ad Place!

Reviews.Title: “La Bella Venezia”
Reviews.Author: ginacap21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ad Place in Venice during our first trip to Italy. This hotel was very chic and had an eclectic, artsy feel to the decor. The room we stayed in was an upgraded room with a king sized bed draped in beautiful linens and curtains. Our windows overlooked the canal. The hotel was beautiful and we had a very comfortable stay. A couple of things that we loved and didn't like so much: Loved: 1. The room and decor 2. The views! 3. Breakfast in the morning...first taste of a bombolone...a vanilla cream filled ball of deliciousness coated with sugar...yum! 4. Location -- very close to Piazza San Marco and great shopping. Also, kind of "off the beaten path" and hidden away. Very romantic. Negatives: 1. No elevator -- not that big of a deal, but walking up 4 flights of stairs to get to your room after a long day of being left in venice was not ideal. 2. Construction -- there was some construction going on outside our room at one of the neighboring hotels or homes that woke us up early one morning. Not too happy about that considering the jetlag! 3.
