Bathroom -- was very small and tight. Plus, every time you ran the water in the sink or shower the pump would run. It was very loud and annoying, especially when showering. 4. Internet -- Claimed there was wireless, but we couldn't get a connection. Overall, we would recommend staying here and had a great experience. However, if you are a very discriminating traveler, take the negatives into consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny - perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: dalchow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay in venice, Ad place was the perfect hotel for us. The rooms are lovely, very well appointed and modern. The location is excellent & the staff, particulary Kamal were fantastic going above and beyond our expectations on many occasions. We will be staying here again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: number1marketing
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was perfect for our 4 day trip to Venice with our teenage daughter during this year's carnival. Rates were reasonable, we had a junior suite which comprised a 4 poster bed, roll top bath and seperate double fold out sofa bed for our daughter. Facilities in the room were great, tea/coffee machine with milk steamer, flat screen tv in both rooms with sky, Playstation and Ipod dock. Beds were really comfortable. Free wifi throughout the hotel. They had thought of everything Breakfast was right outside our door and served until late in the morning with plenty of choice. Being a small hotel there was plently for everyone and no queues or rush at all. Housekeeping was perfect, plently of fresh towels and room was kept well stocked. Reception staff were really friendly, excellent english. Really convenient for St Marks Square and the Rialto bridge etc. 5 mins walk from the water bus stop at Vallerosso, or water taxi stops outside the front door. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about AD PLACE! Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: afs80
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel and their staff. As everyone has said, Kamal was excellent and the light that shined for my husband and I after travel delays held us over in Paris and kept us from getting to Venice until almost 1am. Kamal kept the hotel open late for us, waiting for our arrival. We were exhausted, cold and wet - but Kamal carried our bags up for us and then brought us a tray of treats and drinks. The rooms at Ad Place are beautiful and the building is charming. Our room overlooked a canal and bridge, and we could overhear gondola music through our window. Breakfast each morning was lovely, the staff gave great recommendations on shops and restaurants. I do not have a single complaint about Ad Place. Venice and the Ad Place were my favorite part of our honeymoon and we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisco82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November for our honeymoon and it was our favorite hotel ever! Rooms were great - spacious, clean (they cleaned every time we left to go anywhere), and very unique. Best of all, the staff went above and beyond to give us a great experience (particularly Kamal). They put together a romantic package for us, and quickly took care of any needs/questions. Was great for the price as well, the hotel is close to St. Mark's square which can be very expensive, but we were able to afford it on our grad student honeymoon budget. Venice is a little quiet in November (just after tourist season), but this was good for us on our honeymoon. One suggestion though would be to skip the Murano glass factory tour unless you plan to spend thousands of dollars on glass art, they are pushy and there's better ways to spend your time in such a beautiful/unique city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: sandy3000
Reviews.Content: As a lot of the other reviews mention this place is very well located, has excellent service and has characterful and quality decor. Kamal, the ubiquitious night manager, offered us complimentary sparkling wine and nibbles both nights we were there and he was very helpful - watch out for his knack of approaching you very seriously only to let you know that he is offering you free champagne! The hotel was very helpful when there was some flooding on our final day, allowing us to overstay our check out to let the tide go down outside. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone staying in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: chacaJapan
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Venice because of this hotel. We were so impressed by the room, gorgeous interior like a Laduree, French patisserie. And all the stuff were so kind and have happy smile! Especially gentleman called, Kamal, although we went back to the hotel very late, he waited for us with a bottle of Champagne. I definitely recommend this hotel to all the friends and I hope to stay this hotel again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Book this if you can”
Reviews.Author: LondonJak
Reviews.Content: I went with my partner between 17 and 20 December 2009 for our last holiday before we have a baby as my wife is pregnant. We had heard that Venice was a romantic place but were not expecting too much. The prices of all the hotels seemed high and the website for AD place convinced my wife to choose it. The instructions to the hotel were brilliant and we chose to take the AVTO direct bus from the airport Marco Polo to Piazzale Roma and then a public ACTV steamboat No1 to the stop of Giglio from which the hotel is a 2 min walk. This was the cheapest way and not too difficult. Total cost 9.5 euro each Venice is an extremely beautiful place and took our breath away. The views from the Grand Canal make you feel in awe of the place. Please ensure if you travel in winter to wrap up warm, take hats that cover your ears, do not forget your scarf and take wellies. Venice is land locked and the tide goes in and out. You will see the walkways flooded in the morning but not to worry they will clear by 12. The hotel is a boutique hotel with a lot of class. You will not be disappointed. There is no lift but you will get help to your room with the bags. The staff are excellent. The manager Allesandro is so helpful and always has a smile on his face. He will assist you with anything. I am a Muslim and he helped me with directions to a mosque for Friday prayer (steamboat to Piazzale Roma and the a no 6/ bus to Panorama, get off, take a left and follow the crowd). His right hand man Endo who serves breakfast also was good with the banter and assistance with anything. The night manager Kamal also did a stand up professional and friendly job. He served tea, recommended restaurants and places to go out. We at no point could complain with the service or facilities at this hotel. We had a superior room (the purple picture) on the same floor as the breakfast area. There was a view of the canal where the people were dropped off at the Opera House for the show and we could hear the music. The decor was a flat screen TV, iPod dock and velvet covered everything else. It felt like the room was in a palace and my wife felt like a queen for those 4 days. There was even a fresh rose on a holder in the mirror and fresh fruit laid out on arrival. We were offered champagne but refused as we do not drink. The room was cleaned properly sometimes twice a day and toiletries were a plenty. Anything you want is served quickly and efficiently. We were served tea with different cakes and biscuits every day in our room at about 5.30pm and the fare was of the highest standard. Breakfast was continental with eggs also on offer. At each stage in respect of food you could not fault the quality as everything was fresh and they had tea bags from Scotland. On one night we were served fresh blueberries, raspberries, satsumas on a plate surrounded by flowers. In terms of sightseeing I suggest you do not buy the day pass for the steam boat as you will not need it. You can walk everywhere with St Marks Square 5 minutes from the hotel and Rialto (famous bridge) just a bit more. The walks are enchanting (signposted well) as the streets are narrow with little bridges covering the canals everywhere and beautiful architecture at every turn. You must get a hotel near to the square otherwise you will regret it. We did not have much time so on one day saw the Doge palace, St Mark's church and museums which were all included in the 12 euro ticket. On the other days we relaxed, went for a gondola ride (you have to go on one in Venice) and went to the included glass factory tour. Please bear in mind the glass factory pays for your water taxi there and then you have to make your own way back. The items at the glass factory are very expensive and the sales people are pushy so look out. one evening we saw a concert with 7 violins which warmed the heart on a frosty evening. Venice was better than I expected. It is rich not only in the way it looks but also the delicious food. We concentrated on Pizzas and pastas of which there are plenty. Food is not cheap and expect for 2 to pay 30-40 euro for each meal at least and thatâ€™s without alcohol. I can highly recommend the Rosa Rossa restaurant which is quite close to the hotel where I had an exquisite seafood risotto which the chef made to my specification. The atmosphere was delightful as was the quality. All in all a brilliant trip made all the more better by one of the best hotels we have stayed at and we have stayed at a lot. I was not surprised that it is so high on the popularity index. You get what you pay for and I felt we got more than what we paid for which is a refreshing surprise. We thank all the staff at the hotel for a memorable stay and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A seriously good find”
Reviews.Author: EtotheJ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a last minute deal through 'lastminute.com' for a three night stay at AD place. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor so knew that it had already had excellent reviews. The hotel was situated a five minute walk from St Marks, and looked out onto one of the many stunning canals in Venice. Our room was just how it looked in the pictures, and we were looked after like royalty! Kamal who was working nights when we were there brought us champage, fruit every night we returned from supper, and when we had to leave at 3.30am, he brought us Espressos and a goody bag to take to the airport. He also recommended some lovely restaurants that were not too expensive (whilst in Venice your perception of prices does go slightly out the window, we were charged â‚¬6.50 for a can of coke in some places!!!). I would thouroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice, and would just like to thank Kamal again for making our trip so special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location with very helpful owner and staff”
Reviews.Author: londoneyes
Reviews.Content: AD Place is a great hotel, newly refurbished with fantastic decor, just off the main thoroughfare in a quite location, but within a few minutes walk of San Marco and the Rialto. We spent a weekend in Venice during November and would highly recommend the AC Place - its definitely one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. The owner and staff are all extremely helpful and recommended some really good bars and restaurants that are frequented by local venetians, rather than tourists. The hotel is set over 3 or 4 floors with 12 rooms - our room was very spacious and cosy, really well decorated and very quite. Breakfast was also very good - scrambled eggs, bacon, cured meats, cheese, croissants and pastries were available along with loads of fresh fruit . Romantic and quiet hotel to spend your days in Venice with your other half... Will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Bliss!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andyrock
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! We stayed in this hotel 3 nights having selected it based on other trip advisor reviews. Having worked in managment in the hotel industry I know what to expect from a hotel and this is without doubt the best hotel we have every stayed in, the staff would put the irish hospitality industry to shame! On the day we arrived the hotel offered us a free bottle of champagne and platter of goodies because they noted it was my girlfriends Birthday, that evening as we went out for dinner in the rain, the Night Manager 'Kamal' came running out after us with an Umbrella. Later that evening I proposed to my girlfriend with the assistance of Kamal. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone the staff are fantastic, the rooms are sleek, modern and very comfortable, the hotel is centrally located to San Marc Plaza and all the other main attractions in Venice and breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Ad Place will remain a special place for my Fiancee and I, thanks for all your help Kamal!

Reviews.Title: “Fab service, consistantly top service ,great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cltaylor77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel again, we arrive dlate in the evening and the front of the hotel was tastefully decorated with white lights for Christmas and the reception with large lanterns with candles that had the most divine smell and lovely relaxing music! The hotel staff here are always really kind and even with the high waters the manager and staff made us feel very safe and looked after. No question or request is ever too much and although it is a top scale hotel it always feels like home and the staff like old friends. Fab fab fab breakfast! and smiley reception staff. Thank you for yet again a lovely stay at AD place, see you again soon! I would reccomend this hotel to anyone!, also disabled friendly as they have stair lift

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonDimsum
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel with only 12 rooms. Bold style, well appointed rooms and spacious bathroom. Fabulous, attentive and knowledgeable staff. Kamal welcomed us every evening with little treats and Alessadro helped us find little gems in town.

Reviews.Title: “a charming little venetian jewel,”
Reviews.Author: sheelanewyork
Reviews.Content: what a wonderful place to wake up in and hear the singing coming up your window from a gondola singer passing by... wonderful atmosphere cheerful colors and energy. from the moment we called for booking we knew its the right choice for us. specially kamal was very helpful warm and welcoming and we felt we had a friend before even coming. in fact the whole crew were great friendly and personal. the rooms are beautiful and very clean with fresh smell and the location is close to all main attractions but still quiet. we feel like we found our home in venice and miss it already. Efrat and Xerxes talati (new york ,israel, india)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravel78
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed for 2 nights at AD Place after reading the amazing reviews on this site. Needless to say the reveiws on here are totally correct. What a great place to stay. If you like boutique hotels this is superb! The service is fantastic here, the rooms are wonderful and the location is so romantic. Thank you to Kamal, you made our stay great with the free champagne you served us in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jistria
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has something of this magical feeling that overwhelms you when you arrive in Venice. Bordering a small canal, it arouses a very romantic atmosphere. the decoration is just beautiful. I would advise this hotel for anyone willing to spend a romantic moment. I went there with my girlfriend to ask her for marriage. The staff was just amazing, in particular Kabal, an indian guy who offered us a bottle of champagne and a bouquet of roses to my wife. What else could I say? The hotel has a beutiful private terrass over Venice's roofs. It is really a magical place in a wonderful setting with a pleasant and devoted staff. Thank you for all.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Sexy, Smart - - A Venitian Slice of Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne111
Reviews.Content: Ad Place is absolutely gorgeous. Hip, sleek, sexy and a lot of fun, all enhanced by the spectacular service of the staff, who are warm, knowlegable and engaging (thank you, Alessandro!! et al!!). Some days it was just hard to decide between staying tucked into the luxury of this stunnning boutique hotel or evnturing our into spectacular Venice. Some of the icing on the Ad PLace cake is the charming rooftop oasis, the perfect place for enjoying the sweeping views of the city and having an afternoon glass of wine or your morning coffee. Another big plus is a lush and generous breakfast buffet on the top floor - - included in the price of your room. We cannot wait to go back.

HotelInfo.Name: AD Place Venice
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco - Fondamenta della Fenice 2557/A, 30124 Venice, Italy
